Page	O
27	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
1	O
:	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consisting	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
“	O
the	O
Group	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
,	O
incorporated	O
in	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
laws	O
of	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands	O
on	O
14	O
May	O
1990	O
under	O
the	O
BVI	O
Business	O
Companies	O
Act.	O

The	O
Company	O
maintains	O
registered	O
offices	O
in	O
Western	O
Australian	O
and	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
on	O
29	O
September	O
2021.	O

The	O
directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
“	O
IFRS	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
“	O
IASB	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
The	O
Group	O
applied	O
all	O
new	O
and	O
amended	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
and	O
Interpretations	O
that	O
were	O
effective	O
1	O
July	O
2020	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
Amendments	O
on	O
IFRS	O
3	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
a	O
Business	O
Amendments	O
to	O
IFRS	O
3	O
to	O
clarify	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
assisting	O
entities	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
a	O
transaction	O
should	O
be	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
or	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
acquisition.	O

The	O
amendments	O
:	O
(	O
a	O
)	O
clarify	O
that	O
to	O
be	O
considered	O
a	O
business	O
,	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
must	O
include	O
,	O
at	O
a	O
minimum	O
,	O
an	O
input	O
and	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
that	O
together	O
significantly	O
contribute	O
to	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
create	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
b	O
)	O
remove	O
the	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
market	O
participants	O
are	O
capable	O
of	O
replacing	O
any	O
missing	O
inputs	O
or	O
processes	O
and	O
continuing	O
to	O
produce	O
outputs	O
;	O
(	O
c	O
)	O
add	O
guidance	O
and	O
illustrative	O
examples	O
to	O
help	O
entities	O
assess	O
whether	O
a	O
substantive	O
process	O
has	O
been	O
acquired	O
;	O
(	O
d	O
)	O
narrow	O
the	O
definitions	O
of	O
a	O
business	O
and	O
of	O
outputs	O
by	O
focusing	O
on	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
customers	O
and	O
by	O
removing	O
the	O
reference	O
to	O
an	O
ability	O
to	O
reduce	O
costs	O
;	O
and	O
(	O
e	O
)	O
add	O
an	O
optional	O
concentration	O
test	O
that	O
permits	O
a	O
simplified	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
an	O
acquired	O
set	O
of	O
activities	O
and	O
assets	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
business.	O

The	O
application	O
of	O
IFRS	O
3	O
has	O
not	O
materially	O
impacted	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

Amendments	O
on	O
IAS	O
1	O
and	O
IAS	O
8	O
–	O

Definition	O
of	O
Material	O
This	O
standard	O
principally	O
amends	O
IAS	O
1	O
Presentation	O
of	O
Financial	O
Statements	O
and	O
IAS	O
8	O
Accounting	O
Policies	O
,	O
Changes	O
in	O
Accounting	O
Estimates	O
and	O
Errors.	O

The	O
amendments	O
refine	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
in	O
IAS	O
1.	O

The	O
amendments	O
clarify	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material	O
and	O
its	O
application	O
by	O
improving	O
the	O
wording	O
and	O
aligning	O
the	O
definition	O
across	O
IFRS	O
Standards	O
and	O
other	O
publications.	O

The	O
amendment	O
also	O
includes	O
some	O
supporting	O
requirements	O
in	O
IAS	O
1	O
in	O
the	O
definition	O
to	O
give	O
it	O
more	O
prominence	O
and	O
clarifies	O
the	O
explanation	O
accompanying	O
the	O
definition	O
of	O
material.	O

The	O
application	O
of	O
this	O
amendments	O
has	O
not	O
materially	O
impacted	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O
Early	O
adoption	O
of	O
standards	O
The	O
Group	O
did	O
not	O
elect	O
to	O
apply	O
any	O
pronouncements	O
before	O
their	O
operative	O
date	O
in	O
the	O
annual	O
reporting	O
period	O
beginning	O
1	O
July	O
2020.	O

(	O
iii	O
)	O
Historical	O
cost	O
convention	O
Except	O
for	O
certain	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
under	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
convention.	O

(	O
iv	O
)	O
Going	O
concern	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuity	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
activities	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O

Page	O
28	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
incurred	O
a	O
net	O
loss	O
after	O
tax	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
of	O
$1	O
,	O
133	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
loss	O
$379	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
and	O
had	O
a	O
net	O
cash	O
outflow	O
from	O
operating	O
and	O
investing	O
activities	O
of	O
$2	O
,	O
036	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
$2	O
,	O
988	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
were	O
$14	O
,	O
684	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
30	O
June	O
2020	O
:	O
$11	O
,	O
233	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
flow	O
forecasts	O
through	O
to	O
30	O
September	O
2022	O
reflect	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
raise	O
additional	O
working	O
capital	O
during	O
this	O
period	O
to	O
enable	O
it	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
committed	O
administration	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
operational	O
expenditure	O
over	O
this	O
period.	O

The	O
Directors	O
are	O
satisfied	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
secure	O
additional	O
working	O
capital	O
as	O
required	O
via	O
one	O
or	O
a	O
combination	O
of	O
,	O
a	O
placement	O
of	O
shares	O
,	O
option	O
conversions	O
,	O
rights	O
issues	O
,	O
or	O
joint	O
venture	O
arrangements	O
or	O
sale	O
of	O
certain	O
assets.	O

Accordingly	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
consider	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
prepare	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis.	O

In	O
the	O
event	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
unable	O
to	O
raise	O
additional	O
working	O
capital	O
to	O
meet	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ongoing	O
operational	O
and	O
exploration	O
commitments	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
significant	O
uncertainty	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
the	O
Group	O
will	O
be	O
able	O
to	O
meet	O
its	O
debts	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
they	O
fall	O
due	O
and	O
thus	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
do	O
not	O
include	O
any	O
adjustments	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
recoverability	O
and	O
classification	O
of	O
recorded	O
asset	O
amounts	O
,	O
nor	O
to	O
the	O
amounts	O
or	O
classification	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Subsidiaries	O

and	O

of	O
all	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
(	O
“	O

”	O
or	O
“	O

entity	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O

as	O
the	O
Group	O
or	O
the	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O

over	O
which	O

Group	O
is	O

,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O

from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
and	O
has	O
the	O

to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee.	O

Specifically	O
,	O
the	O
Gorup	O
controls	O
a	O
investee	O
if	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
if	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
:	O
•	O

Power	O
over	O
the	O

(	O

Existing	O
rights	O
that	O

it	O
the	O
current	O

to	O
direct	O
the	O
relevant	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
investee	O
)	O
•	O

Exposure	O
,	O
or	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
•	O

The	O
ability	O
to	O
use	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
to	O
affect	O
its	O
return	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
less	O
than	O
a	O

of	O
the	O
voting	O
or	O
similar	O
rights	O
of	O
an	O
investee	O
,	O

all	O
relevant	O

and	O

in	O

•	O

of	O
the	O
investee	O
•	O

Rights	O

from	O
other	O

•	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
potential	O
voting	O
rights	O
The	O
Group	O
re-assesses	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
it	O
controls	O
an	O
investee	O
if	O
facts	O
and	O

are	O
changes	O

of	O
more	O

Subsidiaries	O

Intercompany	O

and	O

between	O
Group	O

Unrealised	O

unless	O

of	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
asset	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O

have	O
been	O
aligned	O
where	O

to	O

by	O

Group.	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O
Changes	O
in	O
ownership	O
interests	O
The	O
Group	O
treats	O
transactions	O
with	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
that	O
do	O
not	O

in	O
a	O

of	O

as	O
transactions	O
with	O
equity	O

of	O
the	O
Group.	O

A	O

in	O

interest	O

in	O
an	O

between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
Page	O
29	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
the	O
controlling	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
to	O
reflect	O
their	O
relative	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O

Any	O

between	O

to	O

of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited.	O

The	O

(	O
c	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
an	O
entity	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
whose	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
entity's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O

Operating	O
segments	O
are	O
reported	O
in	O
a	O
manner	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
internal	O
reporting	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker.	O

The	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
,	O
who	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
allocating	O
resources	O
and	O
assessing	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
operating	O
segments	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O

(	O
d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
applicable	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O

The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
charge	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
laws	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
the	O
countries	O
where	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
operate	O
and	O
generate	O
taxable	O
income.	O

Management	O
periodically	O
evaluates	O
positions	O
taken	O
in	O
tax	O
returns	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
situations	O
in	O
which	O
applicable	O
tax	O
regulation	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interpretation.	O

It	O
establishes	O
provisions	O
where	O
appropriate	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authorities.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
not	O
accounted	O
for	O
if	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
affects	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
by	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
related	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
a	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
settled.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
controlled	O
entities	O
where	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O

Current	O
and	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O

Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
is	O
also	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
respectively.	O

(	O
e	O
)	O
Leases	O
The	O
Group	O
assesses	O
at	O
contract	O
inception	O
whether	O
a	O
contract	O
is	O
,	O
or	O
contains	O
,	O
a	O
lease.	O

That	O
is	O
,	O
if	O
the	O
contract	O
conveys	O
the	O
right	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
an	O
identified	O
asset	O
for	O
a	O
period	O
of	O
time	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
consideration	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
Page	O
30	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
cost	O
,	O
less	O
any	O
accumulated	O
depreciation	O
and	O
impairment	O
losses	O
,	O
and	O
adjusted	O
for	O
any	O
remeasurement	O
of	O
lease	O
liabilities.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
right-of-use	O
assets	O
includes	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
lease	O
liabilities	O
recognised	O
,	O
initial	O
direct	O
costs	O
incurred	O
,	O
and	O
lease	O
payments	O
made	O
at	O
or	O
before	O
the	O
commencement	O
date	O
less	O
any	O
lease	O
incentives	O
received.	O

Unless	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
reasonably	O
certain	O
to	O
obtain	O
ownership	O
of	O
the	O
leased	O
asset	O

of	O
the	O
lease	O
term	O
,	O
the	O
recognised	O
right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O

on	O
a	O
straight-line	O
basis	O
over	O
the	O
shorter	O
of	O
its	O
estimated	O
useful	O
life	O
and	O
the	O
lease	O
term.	O

Right-of-use	O
assets	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
impairment.	O

Lease	O
liabilities	O
Lease	O
liabilities	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
on	O
a	O
similar	O
basis	O
to	O
other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
,	O
whereby	O
interest	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
liability	O
and	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
lease	O
liability	O
is	O
reduced	O
to	O
reflect	O
the	O
principal	O
portion	O
of	O
lease	O
payments	O
made.	O

Short-term	O
leases	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O
low	O
value	O
assets	O
The	O
Group	O
applies	O
the	O

lease	O
recognition	O

to	O
its	O

of	O

and	O

rental	O
(	O
i.e.	O

of	O
12	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
from	O
the	O

date	O
and	O
do	O
not	O

a	O

option	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
also	O

the	O
low	O
value	O
assets	O
recognition	O
exemption	O
to	O
its	O
low	O
value	O
assets.	O

Lease	O
payments	O
made	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O

of	O
12months	O
or	O
less	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O
low	O
value	O
assets	O
(	O
for	O
which	O
a	O
lease	O
asset	O
and	O
a	O
lease	O
liability	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
recognised	O
)	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
on	O
a	O
straightline	O
basis	O
over	O
the	O
lease	O
term.	O

(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
non-current	O
assets	O
Non-current	O
assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O

An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O
of	O
the	O
cash	O
inflows	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
units	O
)	O
.	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
that	O
suffered	O
an	O
impairment	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
possible	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

(	O
g	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O

equivalents	O

statement	O
of	O

flows	O
presentation	O
purposes	O

and	O

months	O

are	O

to	O

and	O

(	O
h	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
Financial	O
assets	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
(	O
OCI	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O

The	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
contractual	O
cashflow	O
characteristics	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
them.	O

With	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
the	O
Groups	O
trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
initially	O
measures	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
at	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
plus	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
not	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
less	O
transaction	O
costs.	O

Receivables	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
In	O
order	O
for	O
a	O
receivable	O
to	O
be	O
classified	O
and	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
it	O
needs	O
to	O
give	O
rise	O
to	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
‘	O
solely	O
payments	O
of	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
on	O
the	O
principal	O
amount	O
outstanding.	O

For	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
these	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

The	O
amortised	O
cost	O
is	O
reduced	O
by	O
impairment	O
losses.	O

For	O
short	O
term	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
based	O
on	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

In	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
required	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
utilises	O
its	O
historical	O
credit	O
loss	O
experience	O
,	O
adjusted	O
only	O
where	O
appropriate	O
for	O
forward-looking	O
factors	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
debtors	O
and	O
economic	O
environment.	O

The	O
Group	O
considers	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
contractual	O
payments	O
are	O
90	O
days	O
past	O
due.	O

However	O
,	O

also	O

a	O
financial	O
asset	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
internal	O
or	O
external	O
information	O
indicates	O
that	O
Page	O
31	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O

STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
the	O

Group.	O

A	O

is	O

no	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O

or	O

Financial	O

”	O

designated	O
upon	O

or	O

,	O

required	O
to	O
be	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
acquired	O
for	O
the	O

of	O

term.	O

Derivatives	O

including	O
separated	O

derivatives	O

are	O
also	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O

are	O

as	O

instruments.	O

The	O
group	O
holds	O
equity	O

which	O
are	O
mandatorily	O
classified	O
as	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O

at	O

value	O
with	O
changes	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
being	O
included	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Fair	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
price	O
the	O
Group	O
would	O
receive	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
would	O
have	O
to	O

to	O

between	O
independent	O
,	O

and	O
willing	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date.	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
All	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
stated	O
at	O
historical	O
cost	O
less	O
accumulated	O
depreciation	O
and	O
accumulated	O
impairment.	O

Historical	O
cost	O
includes	O
expenditure	O
that	O
is	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
items.	O

Subsequent	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
or	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
only	O
when	O
it	O
is	O

that	O

associated	O
with	O

to	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O

cost	O
of	O

The	O

amount	O
of	O

as	O

All	O

of	O

or	O

income	O
during	O

reporting	O

in	O
which	O
they	O

Depreciation	O

method	O
to	O

their	O

,	O
net	O
of	O

shorter	O
of	O

term	O
and	O

’	O

useful	O
life.	O

The	O

between	O
25%	O
and	O
40%	O
per	O
annum.	O

The	O
assets	O
’	O

are	O
reviewed	O
,	O
and	O

if	O

,	O

amount	O

1	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

)	O

benefits	O

up	O

date	O

unit	O
credit	O
method.	O

Consideration	O
is	O
given	O
to	O
expected	O
future	O
wage	O
and	O
salary	O
levels	O
,	O
experience	O
of	O
employee	O

and	O
periods	O
of	O
service.	O

yields	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
on	O
high	O

match	O
,	O
as	O

as	O

,	O

estimated	O

(	O
m	O
)	O

payments	O

Group	O

to	O

)	O

whereby	O

.	O

to	O

The	O

‘	O

.	O

The	O

date	O

)	O

at	O
balance	O
date.	O

No	O

No	O

of	O

of	O
financial	O

p	O
)	O

Estimates	O

Errors	O
(	O
s	O
)	O
Critical	O
accounting	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
certain	O
critical	O
accounting	O
estimates.	O

It	O
also	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
exercise	O
its	O
judgement	O
in	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
applying	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies.	O

The	O
areas	O
involving	O
a	O
higher	O
degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O
complexity	O
,	O
or	O
areas	O
where	O
assumptions	O
and	O
estimates	O
are	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
:	O
Rehabilitation	O
provision	O
The	O
ultimate	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
are	O
uncertain	O
,	O
and	O
cost	O
estimates	O
can	O
vary	O
in	O
response	O
to	O
many	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
extent	O
and	O
costs	O
of	O
rehabilitation	O
activities	O
,	O
technological	O
changes	O
,	O
regulatory	O
changes	O
and	O
cost	O
increases.	O

These	O
uncertainties	O
may	O
result	O
in	O
future	O
actual	O
expenditure	O
differing	O
from	O
the	O
amounts	O
currently	O
provided.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
significant	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
are	O
made	O
in	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
for	O
rehabilitation.	O

As	O
a	O
result	O
,	O
there	O
could	O
be	O
significant	O
adjustments	O
to	O
the	O
provisions	O
established	O
which	O
would	O
affect	O
future	O
financial	O
results.	O

The	O
provision	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
represents	O
management	O
’	O
s	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
future	O
rehabilitation	O
costs	O
required.	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
The	O
application	O
of	O
the	O
accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
exploration	O
expenditure	O
requires	O
judgement	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
is	O
considered	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
recoverable	O
by	O
future	O
exploitation	O
or	O
sale	O
or	O
where	O
the	O
activities	O
have	O
not	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
reserves.	O

This	O
policy	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
certain	O
estimates	O
as	O
to	O
future	O
events	O
and	O
circumstances	O
,	O
in	O
particular	O
whether	O
an	O
economically	O
viable	O
extraction	O
operation	O
can	O
be	O
established.	O

Any	O
such	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
may	O
change	O
as	O
new	O
information	O
becomes	O
available.	O

If	O
,	O
after	O
having	O
capitalised	O
the	O
expenditure	O
under	O
the	O
policy	O
,	O
a	O
judgement	O
is	O
made	O
that	O
the	O
recovery	O
of	O
the	O
expenditure	O
is	O
unlikely	O
,	O
the	O
relevant	O
capitalised	O
amount	O
will	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
to	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O

Taxation	O
Balances	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
the	O
notes	O
thereto	O
related	O
to	O
taxation	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
best	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O

These	O
estimates	O
take	O
into	O
account	O
both	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
and	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
they	O
pertain	O
to	O
current	O
income	O
taxation	O
legislation	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
directors	O
understanding	O
thereof.	O

No	O
adjustment	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
for	O
pending	O
or	O
future	O
taxation	O
legislation.	O

The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
position	O
represents	O
that	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
,	O
pending	O
an	O
assessment	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office.	O

Impairment	O
The	O
Group	O
assesses	O
impairment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
by	O
evaluating	O
conditions	O
and	O
events	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
indicative	O
of	O
impairment	O
triggers.	O

Recoverable	O
amounts	O
of	O
relevant	O
assets	O
are	O
reassessed	O
only	O
when	O
a	O
trigger	O
is	O
identified	O
using	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
incorporate	O
various	O
key	O
assumptions.	O

35	O

)	O

2	O
:	O
FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
expose	O
it	O
to	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
financial	O
risks	O
:	O
market	O
risk	O
(	O
including	O
currency	O
risk	O
,	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
,	O
commodity	O
price	O
risk	O
and	O
equity	O
price	O
risk	O
)	O
,	O
credit	O
risk	O
and	O
liquidity	O
risk.	O

Risk	O
management	O
is	O
carried	O
out	O
by	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
believes	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
crucial	O
for	O
all	O
board	O
members	O
to	O
be	O
involved	O
in	O
this	O
process.	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Market	O
risk	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Foreign	O
exchange	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
operates	O
entirely	O
in	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
significantly	O
exposed	O
to	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
risk.	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O
Commodity	O
price	O
risk	O
Given	O
the	O
current	O
level	O
of	O
operations	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
statements	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
are	O
not	O
exposed	O
to	O
commodity	O
price	O
risk.	O

(	O
iii	O
)	O
Interest	O
rate	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
movements	O
in	O
market	O
interest	O
rates	O
on	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents.	O

The	O
Group	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
monitor	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
yield	O
curve	O
out	O
to	O
six	O
months	O
to	O
ensure	O
a	O
balance	O
is	O
maintained	O
between	O
the	O
liquidity	O
of	O
cash	O
assets	O
and	O
the	O
interest	O
rate	O
return.	O

The	O
entire	O
balance	O
of	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
for	O
the	O
Group	O
of	O
$3	O
,	O
354	O
,	O
000	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
$907	O
,	O
000	O
)	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk.	O

The	O
weighted	O
average	O
interest	O
rate	O
received	O
on	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
was	O
0.16%	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
0.42%	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
b	O
)	O
Credit	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
has	O
no	O
significant	O
concentrations	O
of	O
credit	O
risk.	O

The	O
maximum	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
at	O
balance	O
date	O
is	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
provision	O
for	O
impairment	O
)	O
of	O
those	O
assets	O
as	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
and	O
notes	O
to	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

All	O

cash	O

within	O
the	O
Group	O
are	O
currently	O
invested	O
with	O
AA-	O
rated	O
financial	O
institutions.	O

(	O
c	O
)	O
Liquidity	O
risk	O
The	O
Group	O
manages	O

risk	O

(	O
c	O
)	O
Capital	O
risk	O
management	O
The	O
Group	O
defines	O
capital	O
as	O
issued	O
share	O
capital.	O

Its	O
objective	O
when	O
managing	O
capital	O
is	O
to	O
safeguard	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
so	O
that	O
it	O
may	O
strive	O
to	O
provide	O
returns	O
for	O
shareholders	O
and	O
benefits	O
for	O
other	O
stakeholders.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
nature	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities	O
,	O
being	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
ready	O
access	O
to	O
credit	O
facilities	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
primary	O
source	O
of	O
funding	O
being	O
equity	O
raisings.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
the	O
focus	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
capital	O
risk	O
management	O
is	O
the	O
current	O
working	O
capital	O
position	O
against	O
the	O
requirements	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
meet	O
exploration	O
Page	O
40	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
programmes	O
and	O
corporate	O
overheads.	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
strategy	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
appropriate	O

is	O

to	O

,	O

’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
whether	O
impairment	O
indicator	O
assessments	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
commercial	O
viability	O
of	O
extracting	O
mineral	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
,	O
we	O
consider	O
this	O
resources	O
had	O
been	O
demonstrated	O
and	O
whether	O
a	O
key	O
audit	O
matter.	O

it	O
was	O
appropriate	O
to	O
continue	O
to	O
classify	O
the	O
capitalised	O
expenditure	O
for	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
as	O
an	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
asset.	O

►	O

Considered	O
whether	O
there	O
was	O
any	O
other	O
data	O
or	O
information	O
that	O
indicated	O
the	O
carrying	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
capitalised	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
would	O
not	O
be	O
recovered	O
in	O
full	O
from	O
successful	O
development	O
or	O
by	O
sale.	O

►	O

We	O
also	O
assessed	O
the	O
adequacy	O
of	O
the	O
disclosure	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O

mem	O
ber	O
firm	O
of	O

Information	O
other	O
than	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
and	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
thereon	O
The	O
directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
other	O
information.	O

The	O
other	O
information	O
comprises	O
the	O
information	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
2021	O
annual	O
report	O
,	O
but	O
does	O
not	O
include	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
and	O
our	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
thereon.	O

Our	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
does	O
not	O
cover	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
and	O
accordingly	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
express	O
any	O
form	O
of	O
assurance	O
conclusion	O
thereon.	O

In	O
connection	O
with	O
our	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
our	O
responsibility	O
is	O
to	O
read	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
,	O
consider	O
whether	O
the	O
other	O
information	O
is	O
materially	O
inconsistent	O
with	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
or	O
our	O
knowledge	O
obtained	O
in	O
the	O
audit	O
or	O
otherwise	O
appears	O
to	O
be	O
materially	O
misstated.	O

If	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
work	O
we	O
have	O
performed	O
,	O
we	O
conclude	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
a	O

of	O
this	O
other	O
information	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
report	O
that	O
fact.	O

We	O
have	O
nothing	O
to	O
report	O
in	O
this	O
regard.	O

Responsibilities	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
for	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
preparation	O
and	O
fair	O
presentation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
and	O
for	O
such	O
internal	O
control	O
as	O
the	O
directors	O
determine	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
enable	O
the	O
preparation	O
and	O
fair	O
presentation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
that	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error.	O

In	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
,	O
disclosing	O
,	O
as	O
applicable	O
,	O
matters	O
relating	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
of	O
accounting	O
unless	O
the	O
directors	O
either	O
intend	O
to	O
liquidate	O
the	O
Group	O
or	O
to	O
cease	O
operations	O
,	O
or	O
have	O
no	O
realistic	O
alternative	O
but	O
to	O
do	O
so.	O

Auditor	O
’	O
s	O
responsibilities	O
for	O
the	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
Our	O
objectives	O
are	O
to	O
obtain	O
reasonable	O
assurance	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
as	O
a	O
whole	O
is	O
free	O
from	O
material	O
misstatement	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
issue	O
an	O
auditor	O
’	O
s	O
report	O
that	O
includes	O
our	O
opinion.	O

Reasonable	O
assurance	O
is	O
a	O
high	O
level	O
of	O
assurance	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
guarantee	O
that	O
an	O
audit	O
conducted	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
International	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
will	O
always	O
detect	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
when	O
it	O
exists.	O

Misstatements	O
can	O
arise	O
from	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
and	O
are	O
considered	O
material	O
if	O
,	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
aggregate	O
,	O
they	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
the	O
economic	O
decisions	O
of	O
users	O
taken	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
this	O
financial	O
report.	O

As	O
part	O
of	O
an	O
audit	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
International	O
Auditing	O
Standards	O
,	O
we	O
exercise	O
professional	O
judgment	O
and	O
maintain	O
professional	O
scepticism	O
throughout	O
the	O
audit.	O

We	O
also	O
:	O
►	O

Identify	O
and	O
assess	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
material	O
misstatement	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
report	O
,	O
whether	O
due	O
to	O
fraud	O
or	O
error	O
,	O
design	O
and	O
perform	O
audit	O
procedures	O
responsive	O
to	O
those	O
risks	O
,	O
and	O
obtain	O
audit	O
evidence	O
that	O
is	O
sufficient	O
and	O
appropriate	O
to	O
provide	O
a	O
basis	O
for	O
our	O
opinion.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
not	O
detecting	O
a	O
material	O
misstatement	O
resulting	O
from	O
fraud	O
is	O
higher	O
than	O
for	O
one	O
resulting	O
from	O
error	O
,	O
as	O
fraud	O
may	O
involve	O
collusion	O
,	O
forgery	O
,	O
intentional	O
omissions	O
,	O
misrepresentations	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
override	O
of	O
internal	O
control.	O

A	O
mem	O
ber	O
firm	O
of	O
Ernst	O
&	O
Young	O
Global	O
Limited	O
Liability	O
limited	O
by	O
a	O
scheme	O

under	O
Professional	O
Standards	O
Legislation	O
►	O

Obtain	O
an	O
understanding	O
of	O
internal	O
control	O
relevant	O
to	O
the	O
audit	O
in	O
order	O
to	O

audit	O
procedures	O
that	O
are	O
appropriate	O
in	O
the	O
circumstances	O
,	O
but	O
not	O

on	O

of	O

’	O

►	O

Evaluate	O

of	O

►	O

on	O

’	O

of	O
the	O
going	O
concern	O

of	O

and	O
,	O

the	O

whether	O
a	O

or	O

to	O

Our	O

up	O
to	O
the	O

’	O

However	O

to	O

going	O

►	O

Obtain	O

Page	O
54	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
Corporate	O
Governance.	O

The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
to	O
its	O
Shareholders	O
for	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
seeks	O
to	O
communicate	O
with	O
Shareholders.	O

In	O
accordance	O
with	O
ASX	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
4.10.3	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
elected	O
to	O
disclose	O
its	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
policies	O
and	O
its	O
compliance	O
with	O
them	O
on	O
its	O
website	O
,	O
rather	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
Annual	O
Report.	O

,	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
Company's	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
practices	O
is	O
set	O
out	O

53	O
CHAIRMANS	O
’	O
LETTER	O
Dear	O
Shareholders	O
The	O
2019	O
financial	O
year	O
has	O
been	O
the	O
second	O
full	O
year	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
’	O
s	O
exploration	O
activities.	O

Before	O
moving	O
onto	O
LEX	O
’	O
s	O
plans	O
it	O
is	O
clear	O
that	O
the	O
current	O
gold	O
price	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollar	O
terms	O
,	O
is	O
very	O
supportive	O
of	O
gold	O
exploration.	O

Gold	O
continues	O
to	O
play	O
its	O
part	O
as	O
a	O
stable	O
value	O
asset	O
in	O
uncertain	O
times.	O

The	O
advent	O
of	O
negative	O
interest	O
rates	O
should	O
also	O
support	O
gold	O
for	O
many	O
years	O
into	O
the	O
future.	O

In	O
this	O
environment	O
even	O
small	O
gold	O
discoveries	O
are	O
valuable	O
,	O
with	O
every	O
10	O
,	O
000	O
ounces	O
being	O
worth	O
over	O
$20m	O
in	O
gross	O
terms.	O

We	O
already	O
have	O
some	O
of	O
these	O
and	O
have	O
moved	O
to	O
put	O
them	O
under	O
ML	O
’	O
s	O
,	O
but	O
of	O
course	O
we	O
are	O
focused	O
on	O
finding	O
more	O
meaningful	O
orebodies	O
on	O
our	O
extremely	O
prospective	O
ground.	O

As	O
promised	O
last	O
year	O
we	O
have	O
delivered	O
on	O
our	O
intentions	O
to	O
accelerate	O
exploration	O
compared	O
to	O
FY18	O
when	O
we	O
completed	O
131	O
holes	O
for	O
8536m.	O

In	O
FY19	O
we	O
did	O
177	O
holes	O
for	O
13	O
,	O
874m	O
on	O
our	O
own	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
addition	O
at	O
the	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
project	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
completed	O
extensive	O
geophysical	O
work	O
and	O
602	O
holes	O
for	O
33	O
,	O
141m.	O

So	O
,	O
in	O
total	O
779	O
holes	O
for	O
47	O
,	O
015m	O
were	O
completed	O
on	O
Lefroy	O
and	O
Lefroy	O
JV	O
ground	O
during	O
the	O
year.	O

This	O
effort	O
has	O
continued	O
to	O
demonstrate	O
the	O
significant	O
gold	O
endowment	O
of	O
our	O
ground.	O

The	O
current	O
year	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
show	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
fruits	O
of	O
all	O
this	O
“	O
groundwork	O
”	O
.	O

Hopefully	O
we	O
will	O
define	O
some	O
special	O
zones	O
where	O
we	O
can	O
move	O
towards	O
resource	O
definition	O
and	O
then	O
onward	O
to	O
development.	O

At	O
Western	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
has	O
continued	O
to	O
explore	O
and	O
spend	O
toward	O
meeting	O
their	O
minimum	O
expenditure	O
commitment	O
of	O
$4million	O
due	O
by	O
7	O
June	O
2020.	O

Their	O
program	O
will	O
capitalise	O
on	O
the	O
extensive	O
foundation	O
aircore	O
drilling	O
program	O
completed	O
on	O
Lakes	O

and	O
Randall	O
to	O
date	O
,	O
with	O

RC	O
drilling	O
program	O
currently	O
underway	O
at	O
Zanex.	O

aircore	O

generated	O
and	O
enhanced	O
numerous	O
other	O
gold	O

likely	O

we	O
have	O
already	O

more	O
extension	O
drilling	O
at	O
Lucky	O
Strike	O
in	O
August	O
and	O
September	O
2019.	O

continue	O
to	O
find	O

at	O
economic	O
grades	O
and	O

year	O

EXPLORATION	O
OVERVIEW	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
(	O
‘	O
LGP	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
located	O
some	O
50km	O
to	O
the	O
South	O
East	O
of	O
Kalgoorlie	O
in	O
the	O
Eastern	O
Goldfields	O
Province	O
of	O
Western	O
Australia	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
flagship	O
project.	O

The	O
Lefroy	O
Gold	O
Project	O
is	O
wholly	O
owned	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O

The	O
commanding	O
,	O
semi-contiguous	O
,	O
granted	O
land	O
package	O
covers	O
598km2	O
immediately	O
east	O
of	O
and	O
adjoining	O
the	O
world	O
class	O
St	O
Ives	O
Gold	O
camp	O
,	O
operated	O
by	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
Limited	O
(	O
NYSE	O
:	O
GFI	O
)	O
(	O
“	O
Gold	O
Fields	O
”	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
immediately	O
south	O
of	O
the	O
high-grade	O
Mt	O
Monger	O
gold	O
centre	O
operated	O
by	O
Silver	O
Lake	O
Resources	O
Limited	O
(	O
ASX	O
:	O
SLR	O
)	O
.	O

Four	O
gold	O
processing	O
operations	O
are	O
strategically	O
located	O
within	O
50km	O
of	O
the	O
project	O
and	O
provide	O
commercial	O
options	O
for	O
processing	O
any	O
gold	O
discovered.	O

The	O
LGP	O
is	O
referenced	O
in	O
two	O
packages	O
i.e.	O

	O

Eastern	O
Lefroy	O

226km2	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

fault	O
,	O
and	O
	O

372km2	O

agreement	O
with	O
Gold	O

6	O
years	O
of	O

7June	O
2018.	O

covers	O
a	O

of	O
Archaean	O

rocks	O
that	O
are	O

by	O

Western	O

’	O
)	O
,	O
previous	O

and	O

a	O

30km	O

1.7m	O

Au	O

44.7m	O
(	O

0.9m	O
at	O
107g/t	O
Au	O
)	O

a	O

Formation	O
(	O

)	O

)	O

deeper	O

Multiple	O
programs	O
of	O
RC	O
drilling	O
and	O
one	O
diamond	O
drilling	O
program	O
were	O
completed.	O

The	O

(	O

30	O

to	O

has	O

in	O

package	O
over	O
a	O
300m	O

along	O
strike	O
and	O
at	O
depth.	O

New	O

of	O

oxide	O
and	O
primary	O
sulphide	O
altered	O
BIF	O
continue	O
to	O

system	O

further	O

the	O
evolving	O

model.	O

Importantly	O
,	O
integrating	O
results	O
from	O
earlier	O
wide	O
spaced	O
air	O
core	O
drilling	O
along	O
strike	O
now	O
demonstrates	O
the	O
300m	O
zone	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
larger	O
gold	O
system	O
that	O
extends	O
over	O
a	O
700m	O
strike	O
length.	O

The	O
results	O
of	O
the	O
additional	O
drilling	O
have	O
assisted	O
in	O
developing	O
the	O
geological	O
model	O
now	O

by	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
be	O
a	O

of	O
sub-parallel	O
south	O

BIF	O
units	O
of	O
variable	O
thickness	O
separated	O
by	O

of	O
black	O

RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
ensuring	O
that	O
risks	O
and	O

and	O

activities	O
are	O

stated	O

of	O
the	O
Group.	O

Management	O
is	O
a	O

item	O
on	O
the	O
agenda	O
of	O

meetings.	O

is	O
also	O

	O

and	O

risk	O

of	O

	O

ENVIRONMENTAL	O
REGULATION	O
AND	O
PERFORMANCE	O
The	O
Group	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
significant	O
environmental	O
regulation	O
in	O
respect	O
to	O
its	O
exploration	O
activities.	O

The	O
Group	O
aims	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
appropriate	O
standard	O
of	O
environmental	O
care	O
is	O
achieved	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
doing	O
so	O
,	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
aware	O
of	O
and	O
is	O
in	O
compliance	O
with	O
all	O
environmental	O
legislation.	O

The	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O

are	O
not	O

of	O
any	O

of	O

for	O
the	O
year	O
under	O
audit.	O

REMUNERATION	O
OF	O

MANAGEMENT	O
PERSONNEL	O
The	O

and	O

of	O

’	O

-	O

Wade	O
Johnson	O
(	O
Managing	O
Director	O
)	O
Remuneration	O
Policy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
has	O
been	O
designed	O
to	O
align	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
objectives	O
with	O
shareholder	O
and	O
business	O
objectives	O
by	O
providing	O
a	O
fixed	O
remuneration	O
component	O
and	O
offering	O
long-term	O
incentives	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate.	O

The	O
Board	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
believes	O
the	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
to	O
be	O
appropriate	O
and	O
effective	O
in	O
its	O
ability	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitable	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
run	O
and	O
manage	O
the	O
Group.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
,	O
setting	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
for	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
,	O
was	O
developed	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O

The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
a	O
base	O
salary	O
(	O
which	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
factors	O
such	O
as	O
experience	O
)	O
and	O
superannuation.	O

The	O
board	O
will	O
review	O
executive	O
packages	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
it	O
considers	O
it	O
appropriate	O
to	O
do	O
so	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
its	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
,	O
executive	O
performance	O
and	O
comparable	O
information	O
from	O
industry	O
sectors	O
and	O
other	O
listed	O
companies	O
in	O
similar	O
industries.	O

The	O
Board	O
may	O
exercise	O
discretion	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
approving	O
incentives	O
,	O
bonuses	O
and	O
shares	O
under	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Share	O
Plan	O
Trust	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O

The	O
policy	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
for	O
performance	O
that	O
results	O
in	O
long-term	O
growth	O
in	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O

The	O
Managing	O
Director	O
receives	O
the	O
superannuation	O
guarantee	O
contribution	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
government	O
of	O
Australia	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
9.5%	O
for	O
the	O
2019	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
entitled	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
other	O
retirement	O
benefits.	O

The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
comparable	O
companies	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O

The	O
Board	O
determines	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
practice	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O

Independent	O
external	O
advice	O
is	O
sought	O
as	O
and	O
when	O
required.	O

To	O
align	O
directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholder	O
interests	O
,	O
the	O
directors	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
hold	O
shares	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
when	O
considered	O
appropriate	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O

Performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
The	O
Group	O
utilises	O
performance	O
based	O
remuneration	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
motivate	O
directors	O
and	O
employees	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Ltd	O
Share	O
Plan	O
which	O
was	O
approved	O
by	O
shareholders	O
on	O
12	O
September	O
2016.	O

Where	O
utilised	O
,	O
shares	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Plan	O
do	O
not	O
vest	O
until	O
certain	O
hurdles	O
have	O
been	O
met.	O

The	O
hurdles	O
are	O
based	O
around	O
future	O
events	O
that	O
will	O
advance	O
the	O
Company	O
towards	O
its	O
objectives.	O

Use	O
of	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
The	O
Group	O
did	O
not	O
employ	O
the	O
services	O
of	O
any	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
during	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2019.	O

Page	O
25	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
1	O
:	O
SUMMARY	O
OF	O
SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
The	O
principal	O
accounting	O
policies	O
adopted	O
in	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
set	O
out	O
below.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
for	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
consisting	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
“	O
the	O
Group	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
limited	O
by	O
shares	O
,	O
incorporated	O
in	O
and	O
under	O
the	O
laws	O
of	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands	O
on	O
14	O
May	O
1990	O
under	O
the	O
International	O
Business	O
Act	O
(	O
Cap.	O

291	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Company	O
maintains	O
registered	O
offices	O
in	O
Western	O
Australian	O
and	O
the	O
British	O
Virgin	O
Islands.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
were	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
directors	O
on	O
27	O
September	O
2019.	O

The	O
directors	O
have	O
the	O
power	O
to	O
amend	O
and	O
reissue	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

(	O
a	O
)	O
Basis	O
of	O
preparation	O
These	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
“	O
IFRS	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
issued	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
“	O
IASB	O
”	O
)	O
.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
preparing	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
New	O
and	O
amended	O
standards	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
IFRS	O
15	O
Revenue	O
from	O
Contracts	O
with	O
Customers	O
IFRS	O
15	O
and	O
its	O
related	O
amendments	O
supersede	O
IAS	O
11	O
Construction	O
Contracts	O
,	O
IAS	O
18	O
Revenue	O
and	O
related	O
Interpretations.	O

It	O
applies	O
to	O
all	O
revenue	O
arising	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
its	O
customers	O
and	O
became	O
effective	O
for	O
annual	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2018.	O

IFRS	O
15	O
establishes	O
a	O
five-step	O
model	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
revenue	O
arising	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O

It	O
requires	O
revenue	O
to	O
be	O
recognised	O
when	O
(	O
or	O
as	O
)	O
control	O
of	O
a	O
good	O
or	O
service	O
transfers	O
to	O
a	O
customer	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
that	O
reflects	O
the	O
consideration	O
to	O
which	O
an	O
entity	O
expects	O
to	O
be	O
entitled	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
transferring	O
goods	O
or	O
services	O
to	O
a	O
customer.	O

IFRS	O
15	O
requires	O
entities	O
to	O
exercise	O
judgement	O
,	O
taking	O
into	O
consideration	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
relevant	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
when	O
applying	O
each	O
step	O
of	O
the	O
model	O
to	O
contracts	O
with	O
their	O
customers.	O

The	O
standard	O
also	O
specifies	O
the	O
accounting	O
for	O
the	O
incremental	O
costs	O
of	O
obtaining	O
a	O
contract	O
and	O
the	O
costs	O
directly	O
related	O
to	O
fulfilling	O
a	O
contract.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
the	O
standard	O
requires	O
enhanced	O
and	O
extensive	O
disclosures	O
about	O
revenue	O
to	O
help	O
investors	O
better	O
understand	O
the	O
nature	O
,	O
amount	O
,	O
timing	O
and	O
uncertainty	O
of	O
revenue	O
and	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O

The	O
Group	O
adopted	O
IFRS	O
15	O
using	O
the	O
full	O
retrospective	O
method	O
of	O
adoption.	O

The	O
change	O
did	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
material	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
revenue	O
from	O
contracts	O
with	O
customers.	O

There	O
was	O
no	O
net	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows.	O

There	O
was	O
no	O
impact	O
on	O
EPS.	O

IFRS	O
9	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
Measurement	O
and	O
classification	O
IFRS	O
9	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
replaces	O
IAS	O
39	O
Financial	O
Instruments	O
:	O
Recognition	O
and	O
Measurement	O
for	O
annual	O
periods	O
beginning	O
on	O
or	O
after	O
1	O
January	O
2018	O
,	O
bringing	O
together	O
all	O
three	O
aspects	O
of	O
the	O
accounting	O
for	O
financial	O
instruments	O
:	O
classification	O
and	O
measurement	O
;	O
impairment	O
;	O
and	O
hedge	O
accounting.	O

Under	O
IFRS	O
9	O
,	O
debt	O
instruments	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
(	O
FVTPL	O
)	O
,	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
(	O
FVOCI	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
classification	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
two	O
criteria	O
,	O
the	O
Group's	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
whether	O
the	O
instruments	O
’	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
represent	O
‘	O
solely	O
payments	O
of	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
’	O
on	O
the	O
principal	O
amount	O
outstanding	O
(	O
the	O
‘	O
SPPI	O
’	O
criterion	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
has	O
applied	O
IFRS	O
9	O
retrospectively	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
initial	O
application	O
date	O
of	O
1	O
July	O
2018.	O

There	O
was	O
no	O
material	O
impacts	O
on	O
the	O
comparative	O
balances	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
restate	O
comparative	O
information	O
as	O
allowed	O
under	O
IFRS	O
9.	O

On	O
transition	O
,	O
although	O
there	O
were	O
changes	O
to	O
the	O
measurement	O
categories	O
of	O
certain	O
financial	O
instruments	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
,	O
this	O
did	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
material	O
change	O
to	O
their	O
basis	O
of	O
measurement	O
as	O
previously	O
applied	O
under	O
IAS	O
39.	O

The	O
Group	O
has	O
determined	O
that	O
the	O
adoption	O
of	O
AASB	O
9	O
has	O
impacted	O
the	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
1	O
July	O
2018	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O

(	O

(	O

)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
assets	O
In	O
relation	O
to	O
financial	O
assets	O
carried	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
IFRS	O
9	O
requires	O
a	O
forward-looking	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
(	O
‘	O
ECL	O
’	O
)	O
model	O
to	O
be	O
applied	O
as	O
opposed	O
to	O
an	O
incurred	O
credit	O
loss	O
model	O
under	O
IAS	O
39.	O

The	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
model	O
requires	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
and	O
changes	O
in	O
those	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
to	O
reflect	O
the	O
changes	O
in	O
credit	O
risk	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset.	O

As	O
at	O
1	O
July	O
2018	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
reviewed	O
and	O
assessed	O
the	O
existing	O
financial	O
assets	O
for	O
impairment	O
using	O
reasonable	O
and	O
supportable	O
information	O
as	O
to	O
their	O
associated	O
credit	O
risk.	O

The	O
Group	O
concluded	O
that	O
the	O
relevant	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
as	O
noted	O
in	O
the	O
table	O
above	O
,	O
are	O
of	O
low	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
or	O
the	O
lifetime	O
ECL	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
would	O
be	O
negligible.	O

The	O
Group	O
has	O
credit	O
rating	O
and	O
risk	O
management	O
policies	O
in	O
place	O
,	O
the	O
change	O
to	O
a	O
forward-looking	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
approach	O
did	O
not	O
have	O
a	O
material	O
impact	O
on	O
the	O
amounts	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
cash	O
is	O

with	O

AA-	O
financial	O

.	O

,	O

no	O

upon	O

of	O
IFRS	O
9	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

ii	O
)	O

cost	O
convention.	O

(	O
iv	O
)	O
Going	O
concern	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
a	O

concern	O
basis	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O

of	O
normal	O
business	O

and	O

of	O
assets	O
and	O

of	O

in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O

Subsequent	O
to	O
year	O
end	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
raised	O
$3.8	O
million	O
before	O
costs	O
through	O
a	O

placement	O
to	O
sophisticated	O
and	O

investors.	O

Refer	O
to	O

23	O
for	O
further	O
details.	O

Group	O
’	O
s	O
cash	O
flow	O

through	O
to	O
30	O
September	O
2020	O

above	O
capital	O
raising	O
,	O
reflect	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O

to	O

its	O

this	O

,	O

to	O

basis.	O

27	O

STATEMENTS	O

)	O

b	O
)	O
Principles	O
of	O
consolidation	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Subsidiaries	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
incorporate	O
the	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
(	O
“	O
Company	O
”	O
or	O
“	O
parent	O
entity	O
”	O
)	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
June	O
2019	O
and	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
all	O
subsidiaries	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
then	O
ended.	O

Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
together	O
are	O
referred	O
to	O
in	O
these	O
financial	O
statements	O
as	O
the	O
Group	O
or	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
all	O
entities	O
over	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
exposed	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee.	O

Specifically	O
,	O
the	O
Gorup	O
controls	O
a	O
investee	O
if	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
if	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
:	O
	O

Power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
(	O
ie.	O

Existing	O
rights	O
that	O
give	O
it	O
the	O
current	O
ability	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
relevant	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
investee	O
)	O
	O

Exposure	O
,	O
or	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
	O

The	O
ability	O
to	O
use	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
to	O
affect	O
its	O
return	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
less	O
than	O
a	O
majority	O
of	O
the	O
voting	O
or	O
similar	O
rights	O
of	O
an	O
investee	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considers	O
all	O
relevant	O
facts	O
and	O
ciscumstances	O
in	O
assessing	O
whether	O
has	O
power	O
over	O
an	O
investee	O
,	O
including	O
:	O
	O

The	O
contractual	O
arrangement	O
with	O
the	O
other	O
vote	O
holders	O
of	O
the	O
investee	O
	O

Rights	O
arising	O
from	O
other	O
contractual	O
arrangements	O
	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
potential	O
voting	O
rights	O
The	O
Group	O
re-assesses	O
whether	O
or	O
not	O
it	O
controls	O
an	O
investee	O
if	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
there	O
are	O
changes	O
to	O
one	O
of	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
three	O
elements	O
of	O
control.	O

Subsidiaries	O
are	O
fully	O
consolidated	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
obtains	O
control	O
over	O
the	O
subsidiary	O
and	O
ceases	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
loses	O
control.	O

The	O
acquisition	O
method	O
of	O
accounting	O
is	O
used	O
to	O
account	O
for	O
business	O
combinations	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

Intercompany	O
transactions	O
,	O
balances	O
and	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
on	O
transactions	O
between	O
Group	O
companies	O
are	O
eliminated.	O

Unrealised	O
losses	O
are	O
also	O
eliminated	O
unless	O
the	O
transaction	O
provides	O
evidence	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
transferred.	O

Accounting	O
policies	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
have	O
been	O
changed	O
where	O
necessary	O
to	O
ensure	O
consistency	O
with	O
the	O
policies	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O
Changes	O
in	O
ownership	O
interests	O
The	O
Group	O
treats	O
transactions	O
with	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
a	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
as	O
transactions	O
with	O
equity	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

A	O
change	O
in	O
ownership	O
interest	O
results	O
in	O
an	O
adjustment	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
controlling	O
and	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
to	O
reflect	O
their	O
relative	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiary.	O

Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
adjustment	O
to	O
non-controlling	O
interests	O
and	O
any	O
consideration	O
paid	O
or	O
received	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
a	O
separate	O
reserve	O
within	O
equity	O
attributable	O
to	O
owners	O
of	O
Lefroy	O
Exploration	O
Limited.	O

When	O
the	O
Group	O
ceases	O
to	O
have	O
control	O
,	O
any	O
retained	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
entity	O
is	O
remeasured	O
to	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
with	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
initial	O
carrying	O
amount	O
for	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
subsequently	O
accounting	O
for	O
the	O
retained	O
interest	O
as	O
an	O
associate	O
,	O
jointly	O
controlled	O
entity	O
or	O
financial	O
asset.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
any	O
amounts	O
previously	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
that	O
entity	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
if	O
the	O
group	O
had	O
directly	O
disposed	O
of	O
the	O
related	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities.	O

This	O
may	O
mean	O
that	O
amounts	O
previously	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
reclassified	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

(	O
c	O
)	O
Segment	O
reporting	O
An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
defined	O
as	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
an	O
entity	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
whose	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
entity's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
maker	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O

)	O

segments	O

with	O
the	O
internal	O

for	O

and	O

of	O

,	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
as	O
the	O
full	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O

(	O
d	O
)	O
Income	O
tax	O
The	O
income	O
tax	O
expense	O
or	O
revenue	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
is	O
the	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
current	O
year	O
’	O
s	O
taxable	O
income	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
applicable	O
income	O
tax	O
rate	O
for	O
each	O
jurisdiction	O
adjusted	O
by	O
changes	O
in	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
attributable	O
to	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
to	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses.	O

The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
charge	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
tax	O
laws	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
the	O
countries	O
where	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
and	O
associated	O
operate	O
and	O
generate	O
taxable	O
income.	O

Management	O
periodically	O
evaluates	O
positions	O
taken	O
in	O
tax	O
returns	O
with	O
respect	O
to	O
situations	O
in	O
which	O
applicable	O
tax	O
regulation	O
is	O
subject	O
to	O
interpretation.	O

It	O
establishes	O
provisions	O
where	O
appropriate	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
amounts	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
the	O
tax	O
authorities.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
on	O
temporary	O
differences	O
arising	O
between	O
the	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
and	O
their	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
not	O
accounted	O
for	O
if	O
it	O
arises	O
from	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
other	O
than	O
a	O
business	O
combination	O
that	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
of	O
the	O
transaction	O
affects	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
is	O
determined	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
(	O
and	O
laws	O
)	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
by	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
apply	O
when	O
the	O
related	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
realised	O
or	O
a	O
deferred	O
income	O
tax	O
liability	O
is	O
settled.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
for	O
deductible	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
unused	O
tax	O
losses	O
only	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
amounts	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
to	O
utilise	O
those	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
losses.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
liabilities	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
recognised	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
tax	O
bases	O
of	O
investments	O
in	O
controlled	O
entities	O
where	O
the	O
parent	O
entity	O
is	O
able	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
timing	O
of	O
the	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
temporary	O
differences	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
differences	O
will	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future.	O

Current	O
and	O
Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
legally	O
enforceable	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
current	O
tax	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
when	O
the	O
deferred	O
tax	O
balances	O
relate	O
to	O
the	O
same	O
taxation	O
authority	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
,	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O

Current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
the	O
tax	O
is	O
also	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
or	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
respectively.	O

(	O
e	O
)	O
Leases	O
Leases	O
where	O
a	O
significant	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O

are	O
not	O
transferred	O
to	O

Group	O
as	O
lessee	O

classified	O
as	O

Payments	O
made	O
under	O

leases	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
any	O

from	O

)	O

charged	O
to	O

or	O
loss	O
on	O
a	O

basis	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
lease.	O

(	O
f	O
)	O
Impairment	O
of	O
non-current	O
assets	O
Non-current	O
assets	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
impairment	O
whenever	O
events	O
or	O
changes	O
in	O
circumstances	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
may	O
not	O
be	O
recoverable.	O

An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
amount	O
by	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
the	O
higher	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
assessing	O
impairment	O
,	O
assets	O
are	O
grouped	O
at	O
the	O
lowest	O
levels	O
for	O
which	O
there	O
are	O
separately	O
identifiable	O
cash	O
inflows	O
which	O
are	O
largely	O
independent	O
of	O
the	O
cash	O
inflows	O
from	O
other	O
assets	O
or	O
groups	O
of	O
assets	O
(	O
cash-	O
generating	O
units	O
)	O
.	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
that	O
suffered	O
an	O
impairment	O
are	O
reviewed	O
for	O
possible	O
reversal	O
of	O
the	O
impairment	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

(	O
g	O
)	O
Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
For	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
presentation	O
purposes	O
,	O
cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
includes	O
cash	O
on	O
hand	O
,	O
deposits	O
held	O
at	O
call	O
with	O
financial	O
institutions	O
,	O
other	O
short-term	O
highly	O
liquid	O
investments	O
with	O
original	O
maturities	O
of	O
three	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
that	O
are	O
readily	O
convertible	O
to	O
known	O
amounts	O
of	O
cash	O
and	O
not	O
subject	O
to	O
significant	O
risk	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
value	O
,	O
and	O
bank	O
overdrafts.	O

29	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
(	O
CONTINUED	O
)	O
(	O
h	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
Financial	O
assets	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
,	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
,	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
(	O
OCI	O
)	O
,	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O

The	O
classification	O
of	O
financial	O
instruments	O
at	O
initial	O
recognition	O
depends	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
contractual	O
cashflow	O
characteristics	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
them.	O

With	O
the	O
exception	O
of	O
the	O
Groups	O
trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
initially	O
measures	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
at	O
its	O
fair	O
value	O
plus	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
not	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
and	O
loss	O
,	O
less	O
transaction	O
costs.	O

Trade	O
Receivables	O
Trade	O
receivables	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
contain	O
a	O
significant	O
financing	O
component	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
the	O
transaction	O
price	O
determined	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
revenue	O
recognition.	O

For	O
trade	O
receivables	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
applies	O
a	O
simplified	O
approach	O
in	O
calculating	O
ECLs.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
track	O
changes	O
in	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
but	O
instead	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
based	O
on	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

In	O
determining	O
the	O
provision	O
required	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
utilises	O
its	O
historical	O
credit	O
loss	O
experience	O
,	O
adjusted	O
only	O
where	O
appropriate	O
for	O
forward-looking	O
factors	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
debtors	O
and	O
economic	O
environment.	O

The	O
Group	O
considers	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
contractual	O
payments	O
are	O
90	O
days	O
past	O
due.	O

However	O
,	O
in	O
certain	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
may	O
also	O
consider	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
default	O
when	O
internal	O
or	O
external	O
information	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
unlikely	O
to	O
receive	O
the	O
outstanding	O
contractual	O
amounts	O
in	O
full	O
before	O
taking	O
into	O
account	O
any	O
credit	O
enhancements	O
held	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

A	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
written	O
off	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovery.	O

Indicators	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovery	O
include	O
,	O
amongst	O
others	O
,	O
the	O
failure	O
of	O
a	O
debtor	O
to	O
engage	O
in	O
a	O
repayment	O
plan	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
failure	O
to	O
make	O
contractual	O
payments	O
for	O
a	O
period	O
of	O
greater	O
than	O
120	O
days	O
past	O
due.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
material	O
trade	O
receivable	O
for	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
it	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
revenues.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
at	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
at	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
include	O
financial	O
assets	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
,	O
financial	O
assets	O
designated	O
upon	O
initial	O
recognition	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
,	O
or	O
financial	O
assets	O
mandatorily	O
required	O
to	O
be	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
acquired	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
selling	O
or	O
repurchasing	O
in	O
the	O
near	O
term.	O

Derivatives	O
,	O
including	O
separated	O
embedded	O
derivatives	O
,	O
are	O
also	O
classified	O
as	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
unless	O
they	O
are	O
designated	O
as	O
effective	O
hedging	O
instruments.	O

The	O
group	O
hold	O
derivative	O
instruments	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
not	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
,	O
and	O
equity	O
investments	O
which	O
are	O
both	O
mandatorily	O
classified	O
as	O
“	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
”	O
.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
with	O
changes	O
in	O
carrying	O
amount	O
being	O
included	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Fair	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
price	O
the	O
Group	O
would	O
receive	O
to	O
sell	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
pay	O
to	O
transfer	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
an	O
orderly	O
transaction	O
between	O
independent	O
,	O
knowledgeable	O
and	O
willing	O
market	O
participants	O
at	O
the	O
measurement	O
date.	O

(	O
i	O
)	O
Plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
All	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
stated	O
at	O
historical	O
cost	O
less	O
accumulated	O
depreciation.	O

Historical	O
cost	O
includes	O
expenditure	O
that	O
is	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
items.	O

Subsequent	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
or	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
,	O
as	O
appropriate	O
,	O
only	O
when	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
economic	O
benefits	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
item	O
will	O
flow	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
item	O
can	O
be	O
measured	O
reliably.	O

The	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
any	O
component	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
is	O
derecognised	O
when	O
replaced.	O

All	O
other	O
repairs	O
and	O
maintenance	O
are	O
charged	O
to	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
during	O
the	O
reporting	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
incurred.	O

Depreciation	O
of	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
the	O
straight-line	O
method	O
to	O
allocate	O
their	O
cost	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
their	O
residual	O
values	O
,	O
over	O
their	O
estimated	O
useful	O
lives	O
or	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
leasehold	O
improvements	O
and	O
certain	O
leased	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
,	O
the	O
shorter	O
lease	O
term.	O

The	O
rates	O
vary	O
between	O
25%	O
and	O
40%	O
per	O
annum.	O

’	O

reviewed	O
,	O
and	O
adjusted	O
if	O
appropriate	O
,	O
at	O
each	O

date.	O

An	O

’	O
s	O

written	O
down	O
immediately	O
to	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount	O

asset	O
’	O

greater	O
than	O
its	O
estimated	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
(	O
note	O
1	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
)	O
.	O

Gains	O
and	O

on	O

proceeds	O
with	O
carrying	O
amount.	O

of	O

other	O

income.	O

j	O
)	O
Exploration	O

rights	O
to	O

of	O

are	O
current	O
;	O
and	O
	O

at	O
least	O

the	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O

at	O
each	O

date	O
for	O
indicators	O
of	O

for	O

If	O

The	O

the	O

of	O
an	O

’	O

value	O

of	O

and	O
its	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O

Recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
an	O
individual	O
asset	O

or	O

(	O
k	O
)	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
These	O
amounts	O
represent	O
liabilities	O
for	O

and	O

to	O
the	O
Group	O
prior	O
to	O

end	O
of	O

financial	O
year	O
which	O
are	O
unpaid.	O

The	O

are	O
unsecured	O
,	O
non-interest	O
bearing	O
and	O
are	O
paid	O
on	O
normal	O
commercial	O
terms.	O

They	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
at	O
their	O

value	O
and	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

(	O
l	O
)	O

m	O
)	O
Share-based	O
payments	O
The	O
Group	O
may	O
provide	O
benefits	O
to	O
employees	O
(	O
including	O
directors	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
vendors	O
and	O
suppliers	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
share-based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
,	O
whereby	O
employees	O
render	O
services	O
,	O
or	O
where	O
vendors	O
sell	O
assets	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
in	O
exchange	O
for	O
shares	O
or	O
rights	O
over	O
shares	O
(	O
‘	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
these	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
employees	O
is	O

reference	O
to	O
the	O

at	O
the	O
date	O
at	O
which	O
they	O

The	O

is	O
determined	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
by	O
an	O
internal	O
valuation	O
using	O
a	O
Black-Scholes	O
(	O
or	O
other	O
industry	O
accepted	O
)	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
for	O
options	O
and	O
Share	O
Plan	O
shares	O
and	O
by	O
reference	O
to	O
market	O
price	O
for	O
ordinary	O
shares.	O

The	O
Black-Scholes	O
European	O
Option	O
Pricing	O
Model	O
is	O
an	O
industry	O
accepted	O
method	O
of	O
valuing	O
equity	O
instruments.	O

The	O
cost	O
of	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
is	O
recognised	O
,	O
together	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
performance	O
conditions	O
are	O
fulfilled	O
,	O
ending	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
on	O
which	O
the	O
relevant	O
employees	O
become	O
fully	O
entitled	O
to	O
the	O
award	O
(	O
‘	O
vesting	O
date	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
cumulative	O
expense	O
recognised	O
for	O
equity-settled	O
transactions	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
until	O
vesting	O
date	O
reflects	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
the	O
extent	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
vesting	O
period	O
has	O
expired	O
and	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
rights	O
that	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
opinion	O
of	O
the	O
directors	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
will	O
ultimately	O
vest.	O

This	O
opinion	O
is	O
formed	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
best	O
available	O
information	O
at	O
balance	O
date.	O

No	O
adjustment	O
is	O
made	O
for	O
the	O
likelihood	O
of	O
market	O
performance	O
conditions	O
being	O
met	O
as	O
the	O
effect	O
of	O
these	O
conditions	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
at	O
grant	O
date.	O

No	O
expense	O
is	O
recognised	O
for	O
rights	O
that	O
do	O
not	O
ultimately	O
vest	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
rights	O
where	O
vesting	O
is	O
conditional	O
upon	O
a	O
market	O
condition.	O

Where	O
a	O
right	O
is	O
cancelled	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
it	O
had	O
vested	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
cancellation	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
expense	O
not	O
yet	O
recognised	O
for	O
the	O
right	O
is	O
recognised	O
immediately.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
a	O
new	O
option	O
is	O
substituted	O
for	O
the	O
cancelled	O
right	O
,	O
and	O
designated	O
as	O
a	O
replacement	O
right	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
granted	O
,	O
the	O
cancelled	O
and	O
new	O
right	O
are	O
treated	O
as	O
a	O
modification	O
of	O
the	O
original	O
award.	O

(	O
n	O
)	O
Earnings	O
per	O
share	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
Basic	O
earnings	O
per	O
share	O
Basic	O
earnings	O
per	O
share	O
is	O

the	O

attributable	O
to	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
company	O

of	O

equity	O
other	O
than	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
,	O

the	O
weighted	O
average	O
number	O
of	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
outstanding	O
during	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
,	O
adjusted	O
for	O

elements	O
in	O

shares	O
issued	O
during	O

year.	O

(	O
ii	O
)	O

earnings	O
per	O
share	O

The	O

will	O

on	O
the	O
nature	O
or	O

of	O
information.	O

An	O
entity	O
will	O
need	O
to	O
assess	O
whether	O
the	O
information	O
,	O
either	O
individually	O
or	O
in	O
combination	O
with	O
other	O
information	O
,	O
is	O
material	O
in	O
the	O
context	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements.	O

A	O
misstatement	O
of	O
information	O
is	O
material	O
if	O
it	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
expected	O
to	O
influence	O
decisions	O
made	O
by	O
the	O
primary	O
users.	O

34	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O

STATEMENTS	O

)	O

r	O
)	O
Critical	O

judgements	O
,	O

the	O

of	O

’	O
s	O

The	O
areas	O

a	O

degree	O
of	O
judgement	O
or	O

,	O
or	O

:	O

The	O
application	O
of	O
the	O
accounting	O
policy	O
for	O
exploration	O
expenditure	O
requires	O
judgement	O
to	O

whether	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
is	O
considered	O

to	O

by	O
future	O

or	O
sale	O

the	O
activities	O
have	O

which	O
permits	O

of	O
the	O
existence	O
of	O
reserves.	O

This	O
policy	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
certain	O
estimates	O
as	O
to	O
future	O
events	O
and	O
circumstances	O
,	O
in	O
particular	O
whether	O
an	O
economically	O
viable	O
extraction	O
operation	O
can	O
be	O
established.	O

Any	O
such	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
may	O
change	O
as	O
new	O
information	O
becomes	O
available.	O

If	O
,	O
after	O
having	O
capitalised	O
the	O
expenditure	O
under	O
the	O
policy	O
,	O
a	O

that	O

the	O

is	O
unlikely	O
,	O
the	O
relevant	O
capitalised	O
amount	O
will	O
be	O
written	O
off	O
to	O
profit	O
and	O
loss.	O

Taxation	O
Balances	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
and	O
the	O
notes	O
thereto	O
related	O
to	O
taxation	O
are	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
best	O
estimates	O
of	O
the	O
directors.	O

These	O
estimates	O
take	O
into	O
account	O
both	O
the	O
financial	O
performance	O
and	O
position	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
as	O
they	O
pertain	O
to	O
current	O
income	O
taxation	O
legislation	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
directors	O
understanding	O
thereof.	O

No	O
adjustment	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
for	O
pending	O
or	O
future	O
taxation	O
legislation.	O

The	O
current	O
income	O
tax	O
position	O
represents	O
that	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
,	O
pending	O
an	O
assessment	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office.	O

Share-based	O
payments	O
Share-based	O
payment	O
transactions	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
options	O
to	O
acquire	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
and	O
Share	O
Plan	O
shares	O
,	O
are	O
valued	O
using	O
option	O
pricing	O
models.	O

This	O
model	O
uses	O
assumptions	O
and	O
estimates	O
as	O
inputs.	O

Impairment	O
The	O
Group	O
assesses	O
impairment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
by	O
evaluating	O
conditions	O
and	O
events	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
indicative	O
of	O
impairment	O
triggers.	O

Recoverable	O
amounts	O
of	O
relevant	O
assets	O
are	O
reassessed	O
using	O
the	O
directors	O
’	O
best	O
estimate	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
incorporate	O
various	O
key	O
assumptions.	O

Any	O
amounts	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
impaired	O
,	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
accounting	O
policy	O
disclosures	O
in	O
parts	O
1	O
(	O
f	O
)	O
.	O

(	O
s	O
)	O

of	O
amounts	O

statements	O
and	O

’	O

Credit	O
risk	O
Credit	O

and	O
cash	O

of	O

Group	O

The	O
Group	O

the	O

of	O

The	O

it	O

The	O
methods	O
comprised	O
:	O
Level	O
1	O
:	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
calculated	O
using	O
quoted	O
prices	O
in	O
active	O
markets	O
for	O
identical	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities.	O

Level	O
2	O
:	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
estimated	O
using	O
inputs	O
other	O
than	O
quotes	O
prices	O
included	O
in	O
level	O
1	O
that	O
are	O
observable	O
for	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
,	O
either	O
directly	O
(	O
as	O
prices	O
)	O
or	O
indirectly	O
(	O
derived	O
from	O
prices	O
)	O
.	O

Level	O
3	O
:	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
is	O
estimated	O
using	O
valuation	O
techniques	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
lowest	O
level	O
input	O
that	O
is	O
significant	O
to	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
measurement	O
is	O
unobservable.	O

The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O

above	O
were	O

as	O

1	O

	O

paid	O

entitle	O
the	O
holder	O
to	O

in	O

and	O

of	O

Company	O

to	O

a	O

of	O
hands	O
every	O
holder	O
of	O
ordinary	O
fully	O
paid	O
shares	O
present	O

a	O

vote	O
