Geophysics	O
-	O

IP	O
Previous	O
drilling	O
by	O
Prospech	O
at	O
Banky	O
,	O
Bauch	O
and	O
Ignac	O
prospects	O
was	O
designed	O
to	O
test	O
shallow	O
surface	O
targets	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
extension	O
of	O
a	O
major	O
detachment	O
fault	O
(	O
locally	O
known	O
as	O
a	O
Low	O
Angle	O
Normal	O
Fault	O
or	O
LANF	O
)	O
.	O

Mineralisation	O
at	O
the	O
nearby	O
,	O
currently	O
operating	O
Rozalia	O
underground	O
gold	O
mine	O
is	O
controlled	O
by	O
the	O
LANF	O
,	O
the	O
up-dip	O
surface	O
trace	O
of	O
which	O
falls	O
mainly	O
on	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Hodrusa-Hamre	O
exploration	O
licence.	O

For	O
the	O
first	O
time	O
within	O
the	O
Hodrusa-Hamre/Banska	O
Stiavnica	O
mining	O
district	O
,	O
an	O
Induced	O
Polarisation-Resistivity	O
(	O
IP	O
)	O
geophysical	O
survey	O
has	O
been	O
conducted	O
to	O
explore	O
the	O
LANF	O
at	O
depth.	O

A	O
number	O
of	O
IP	O
and	O
resistivity	O
anomalies	O
have	O
been	O
detected	O
by	O
the	O
survey	O
(	O
see	O
figures	O
below	O
)	O
.	O

In	O
general	O
,	O
the	O
IP	O
responses	O
could	O
be	O
described	O
as	O
moderate	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
in	O
keeping	O
with	O
the	O
low	O
to	O
moderate	O
sulphide	O
content	O
of	O
the	O
expected	O
mineralisation	O
style	O
and	O
alteration	O
halo.	O

The	O
Hodrusa-Hamre	O
caldera	O
rocks	O
are	O
,	O
in	O
general	O
,	O
relatively	O
conductive	O
,	O
which	O
limits	O
the	O
survey	O
depth	O
of	O
investigation	O
when	O
compared	O
to	O
more	O
resistive	O
terrains.	O

The	O
survey	O
data	O
is	O
still	O
being	O
evaluated	O
and	O
the	O
anomalies	O
being	O
ranked	O
for	O
drill	O
testing	O
during	O
the	O
2022	O
summer	O
field	O
season.	O

11	O

and	O

DIRECTORS	O
’	O
REPORT	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
Statement	O
The	O
Board	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
maintaining	O
standards	O
of	O
Corporate	O
Governance.	O

Corporate	O
Governance	O
is	O
about	O
having	O
a	O
set	O
of	O
core	O
values	O
and	O
behaviours	O
that	O
underpin	O
the	O
Company's	O
activities	O
and	O
ensure	O
transparency	O
,	O
fair	O
dealing	O
and	O
protection	O
of	O
the	O
interests	O
of	O
stakeholders.	O

The	O
Company	O
has	O
reviewed	O
its	O
corporate	O
governance	O
practises	O
against	O
the	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
Principles	O
and	O
Recommendations	O
(	O
4th	O
edition	O
)	O
published	O
by	O
the	O
ASX	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
Council.	O

Corporate	O
Governance	O
Statement	O
is	O
dated	O
as	O
at	O
30	O
March	O
2022	O
,	O
reflecting	O
the	O
corporate	O
governance	O
practises	O
throughout	O
the	O
2021	O
financial	O
year	O

was	O

by	O

of	O
the	O

on	O

Remuneration	O
Report	O
-	O

(	O
Audited	O
)	O
All	O
amounts	O
in	O
this	O
remuneration	O
report	O
are	O
in	O
Australian	O
Dollars	O
unless	O
otherwise	O
stated.	O

Principles	O
of	O
Compensation	O
-	O

(	O
Audited	O
)	O
Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
have	O
authority	O
and	O
responsibility	O
for	O
planning	O
,	O
directing	O
and	O
controlling	O
the	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
comprise	O
the	O
Directors	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

No	O
other	O
employees	O
have	O
been	O
deemed	O
to	O
be	O
key	O
management	O
personnel.	O

The	O
policy	O
of	O
remuneration	O
of	O
Directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
remuneration	O
package	O
properly	O
reflects	O
the	O
person's	O
duties	O
and	O
responsibilities	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
remuneration	O
is	O
competitive	O
in	O
attracting	O
,	O
retaining	O
and	O
motivating	O
people	O
of	O
the	O
highest	O
quality.	O

Compensation	O
levels	O
have	O
been	O
,	O
and	O
will	O
be	O
,	O
set	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
Australian	O
listed	O
entities	O
of	O
equivalent	O
size	O
and	O
comparable	O
operations	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
suitably	O
qualified	O
and	O
experienced	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
but	O
also	O
having	O
regard	O
to	O
the	O
prevailing	O
financial	O
capacity	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

The	O
Board	O
is	O
responsible	O
for	O
reviewing	O
and	O
evaluating	O
its	O
own	O
performance.	O

The	O
evaluation	O
process	O
is	O
intended	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
Group's	O
business	O
performance	O
,	O
whether	O
long	O
term	O
strategic	O
objectives	O
are	O
being	O
achieved	O
and	O
the	O
achievement	O
of	O
individual	O
performance	O
objectives.	O

Remuneration	O
generally	O
consists	O
of	O
salary	O
payments	O
comprising	O
both	O
short-term	O
salaries	O
and	O
share	O
based	O
payments.	O

The	O
remuneration	O
disclosed	O
below	O
represents	O
the	O
cost	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
for	O
the	O
services	O
provided	O
under	O
these	O
arrangements.	O

Share	O
based	O
payments	O
are	O
issued	O
to	O
directors	O
to	O
incentivise	O
performance	O
that	O
contributes	O
to	O
shareholder	O
wealth.	O

There	O
were	O
no	O
remuneration	O
consultants	O
used	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
the	O
prior	O
year.	O

26	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
1	O
–	O

REPORTING	O
ENTITY	O
Prospech	O
Limited	O
(	O
the	O
‘	O
Company	O
’	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
company	O
domiciled	O
in	O
Australia.	O

The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
report	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
to	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O
comprises	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
its	O
subsidiaries	O
(	O
together	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
‘	O
Prospech	O
’	O
or	O
‘	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Group	O
is	O
a	O
for-profit	O
entity	O
and	O
is	O
involved	O
in	O
exploration	O
for	O
precious	O
metals.	O

NOTE	O
2	O
–	O

BASIS	O
OF	O
PREPARATION	O
Statement	O
of	O
compliance	O
The	O
financial	O
report	O
is	O
a	O
general	O
purpose	O
financial	O
report	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
prepared	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
(	O
‘	O
AASBs	O
’	O
)	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
Australian	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
‘	O
AASB	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act	O
2001.	O

The	O
financial	O
report	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
complies	O
with	O
International	O
Financial	O
Reporting	O
Standards	O
(	O
IFRS	O
)	O
and	O
interpretations	O
adopted	O
by	O
the	O
International	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
Board	O
(	O
‘	O
IASB	O
’	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
financial	O
report	O
was	O
authorised	O
for	O
issue	O
by	O
the	O
Directors	O
on	O
30	O
March	O
2022.	O

Basis	O
of	O
measurement	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
historical	O
cost	O
basis.	O

Functional	O
and	O
presentation	O
currency	O
These	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
presented	O
in	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
functional	O
currency.	O

The	O
functional	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
subsidiaries	O
Prospech	O
Slovakia	O
s.r.o	O
and	O
Slovenske	O
Kovy	O
s.r.o	O
is	O
Euros.	O

Use	O
of	O
estimates	O
and	O
judgements	O
The	O
preparation	O
of	O
financial	O
statements	O
requires	O
management	O
to	O
make	O
judgements	O
,	O
estimates	O
and	O
assumptions	O
that	O
affect	O
the	O
application	O
of	O
accounting	O
policies	O
and	O
the	O
reported	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
,	O
liabilities	O
,	O
income	O
and	O
expenses.	O

Actual	O
results	O
may	O
differ	O
from	O
these	O
estimates.	O

Estimates	O
and	O
underlying	O
assumptions	O
are	O
reviewed	O
on	O
an	O
ongoing	O
basis.	O

Revisions	O
to	O
accounting	O
estimates	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
the	O
estimate	O
is	O
revised	O
and	O
in	O
any	O
future	O
periods	O
affected.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
information	O
about	O
significant	O
areas	O
of	O
estimation	O
uncertainty	O
and	O
critical	O
judgements	O
in	O
applying	O
accounting	O
policies	O
that	O
have	O
the	O
most	O
significant	O
effect	O
on	O
the	O
amount	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
are	O
described	O
in	O
the	O
following	O
notes	O
:	O
-	O

Note	O
2	O
–	O

Going	O
concern	O
-	O

Note	O
6	O
–	O

Income	O
tax	O
expense	O
and	O
the	O
recoverability	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets.	O

-	O

Note	O
8	O
–	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
The	O
accounting	O
policies	O
set	O
out	O
below	O
have	O
been	O
applied	O
consistently	O
by	O
entities	O
in	O
the	O
Group.	O

27	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
2	O
–	O

BASIS	O
OF	O
PREPARATION	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Going	O
concern	O
The	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
basis	O
,	O
which	O
contemplates	O
the	O
continuation	O
of	O
normal	O
business	O
operations	O
and	O
the	O
realisation	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
settlement	O
of	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business.	O

For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
31	O
December	O
2021	O

,	O
846	O
as	O
at	O

2021.	O

,	O
027	O
of	O

,	O

cash	O
on	O

of	O
$2	O
,	O
036	O
,	O
694	O
at	O
31	O
December	O
2021.	O

The	O
Directors	O
have	O
prepared	O
cash	O
flow	O
projections	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
from	O
1	O
January	O
2022	O
to	O

that	O
support	O

of	O
the	O
Group	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O

These	O

assume	O
the	O
Group	O
continues	O
substantial	O
exploration	O
activities	O
in	O
the	O
areas	O
of	O
interest	O

will	O

from	O

other	O
parties	O
that	O
is	O
yet	O
to	O
be	O
secured	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
this	O
report.	O

If	O

is	O
not	O
secured	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
plans	O
to	O
reduce	O
expenditure	O
to	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
funding	O
available.	O

These	O
conditions	O
give	O
rise	O
to	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
that	O
may	O
cast	O
significant	O
doubt	O
upon	O

Group	O
’	O

ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern.	O

The	O
ongoing	O
operations	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
are	O
dependent	O
upon	O
the	O
Group	O

additional	O

from	O
shareholders	O
or	O
other	O
parties	O
and/or	O
the	O
Group	O

expenditure	O
in-line	O
with	O
available	O

In	O

event	O

does	O
not	O

additional	O
funding	O
and/or	O

of	O

3	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
Basis	O
of	O
consolidation	O
Subsidiaries	O
Subsidiaries	O
are	O
entities	O
controlled	O
by	O
the	O
Group.	O

The	O
Group	O
controls	O
an	O
entity	O
when	O
it	O
is	O
exposed	O
to	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
rights	O
to	O
,	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
entity	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
entity.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
subsidiaries	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements	O
from	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
commences	O
until	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
control	O
ceases.	O

Transactions	O
eliminated	O
on	O
consolidation	O
Intragroup	O
balances	O
and	O
any	O
unrealised	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
or	O
income	O
and	O
expenses	O
arising	O
from	O
intragroup	O
transactions	O
(	O
except	O
for	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
transaction	O
gains	O
or	O
losses	O
)	O
,	O
are	O
eliminated	O
in	O
preparing	O
the	O
consolidated	O
financial	O
statements.	O

Where	O
a	O
controlled	O
entity	O
issues	O
shares	O
to	O
minority	O
interests	O
which	O
does	O
not	O
result	O
in	O
loss	O
of	O
control	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
arising	O
on	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
controlled	O
entity	O
is	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity.	O

Foreign	O
currency	O
Foreign	O
currency	O
transactions	O
Transactions	O
in	O
foreign	O
currencies	O
are	O
translated	O
at	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
transaction.	O

Monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
currencies	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
are	O
translated	O
to	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
at	O
the	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rate	O
ruling	O
at	O
that	O
date.	O

Non-monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
that	O
are	O
measured	O
in	O
terms	O
of	O
historical	O
cost	O
in	O
a	O
foreign	O
currency	O
are	O
translated	O
using	O
the	O
exchange	O
rate	O
at	O
the	O
date	O
of	O
the	O
transaction.	O

Non-monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
currencies	O
that	O
are	O
stated	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
are	O
translated	O
to	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
at	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
rates	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
was	O
determined.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
differences	O
arising	O
on	O
translation	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement.	O

the	O
reporting	O

and	O

foreign	O

are	O

at	O
rates	O
approximating	O
the	O

rates	O
ruling	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
of	O
the	O
transactions.	O

Foreign	O

differences	O

on	O
retranslation	O
recognised	O
in	O
Other	O
Comprehensive	O
Income	O
(	O
‘	O
OCI	O
’	O
)	O
and	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
(	O
‘	O
FCTR	O
’	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
separate	O
component	O
of	O
equity.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
arising	O
from	O
a	O
monetary	O
item	O
receivable	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
,	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
neither	O
planned	O
nor	O
likely	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future	O
,	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O
form	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
net	O
investment	O
in	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
and	O
are	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
FCTR.	O

When	O
a	O
foreign	O
operation	O
is	O
disposed	O
of	O
,	O
in	O
part	O
or	O
in	O
full	O
,	O
the	O
relevant	O
amount	O
in	O
foreign	O
operation	O
and	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
OCI	O
and	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
FCTR.	O

Financial	O
instruments	O
Non-derivative	O
financial	O
assets	O
Recognition	O
and	O
initial	O
measurement	O
The	O
Group	O
initially	O
recognises	O
trade	O
receivables	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
originated.	O

All	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
on	O
the	O
trade	O
date	O
at	O
which	O
the	O
Group	O
becomes	O
a	O
party	O
to	O
the	O
contractual	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
instrument.	O

The	O
Group	O
derecognises	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
when	O
the	O
contractual	O
rights	O
to	O
the	O
cash	O
flows	O
from	O
the	O
asset	O
expire	O
,	O
or	O
it	O
transfers	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
a	O
transaction	O
in	O
which	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
are	O
transferred.	O

Any	O
interest	O
in	O
such	O
transferred	O
financial	O
assets	O
that	O
is	O
created	O
or	O
retained	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
separate	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
are	O
offset	O
and	O
the	O
net	O
amount	O
presented	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
when	O
,	O
and	O
only	O
when	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
a	O
legal	O
right	O
to	O
offset	O
the	O
amounts	O
and	O
intends	O
either	O
to	O
settle	O
them	O
on	O
a	O
net	O
basis	O
or	O
to	O
realise	O
the	O
asset	O
and	O
settle	O
the	O
liability	O
simultaneously.	O

On	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
classified	O
as	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
:	O
-	O

amortised	O
cost	O
;	O
-	O

fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
;	O
or	O
-	O

fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
not	O
reclassified	O
subsequent	O
to	O
their	O
initial	O
recognition	O
unless	O
the	O
Group	O
changes	O
its	O
business	O
model	O
for	O
managing	O
financial	O
assets	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
all	O
affected	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
reclassified	O
on	O
the	O
first	O
day	O
of	O
the	O
first	O
reporting	O
period	O
following	O
the	O
change	O
in	O
the	O
business	O
model.	O

A	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
if	O
it	O
meets	O
both	O
the	O
following	O
conditions	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
designated	O
as	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
:	O
-	O

it	O
is	O
held	O
within	O
a	O
business	O
model	O
whose	O
objective	O
is	O
to	O
hold	O
assets	O
to	O
collect	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flows	O
;	O
and	O
-	O

its	O
contractual	O
terms	O
give	O
rise	O
on	O
specified	O
dates	O
to	O
cash	O
flows	O
that	O
are	O
solely	O
payments	O
of	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
on	O
the	O
principal	O
amount	O
outstanding.	O

On	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
an	O
equity	O

that	O
is	O
not	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O

to	O
present	O

changes	O
in	O
the	O
investment	O
’	O
s	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
OCI.	O

This	O
election	O
is	O
made	O
on	O
an	O
investment-by-investment	O
basis.	O

ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O

’	O
t	O
)	O
Financial	O
instruments	O
(	O

’	O
d	O
)	O
Non-derivative	O
financial	O
assets	O
(	O

’	O
d	O
)	O
All	O
financial	O
assets	O
not	O

as	O

or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O

income	O
as	O
described	O
above	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

This	O
includes	O
all	O
derivative	O
financial	O
assets.	O

initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
may	O

a	O

income	O
as	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O

if	O

eliminates	O
or	O
significantly	O
reduces	O
an	O
accounting	O

that	O
would	O
otherwise	O
arise.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
These	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

The	O
amortised	O
cost	O
is	O
reduced	O
by	O
impairment	O
losses.	O

Interest	O
income	O
,	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
and	O
impairment	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Any	O
gain	O
or	O
loss	O
on	O
derecognition	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Equity	O
instruments	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
These	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Dividends	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
income	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
unless	O
the	O
dividend	O
clearly	O
represents	O
a	O
recovery	O
of	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
the	O
investment.	O

Other	O
net	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
and	O
are	O
never	O
reclassified	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Non-derivative	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
Financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

The	O
Group	O
initially	O
recognises	O
debt	O
securities	O
issued	O
and	O
subordinated	O
liabilities	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
originated.	O

All	O
other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
are	O
recognised	O
initially	O
on	O
the	O
trade	O
date	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
date	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
becomes	O
a	O
party	O
to	O
the	O
contractual	O
provisions	O
of	O
the	O
instrument.	O

The	O
Group	O
derecognises	O
a	O
financial	O
liability	O
when	O
its	O
contractual	O
obligations	O
are	O
discharged	O
,	O
cancelled	O
or	O
expire.	O

Other	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
comprise	O
loans	O
and	O
borrowings	O
and	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables.	O

Impairment	O
Financial	O
assets	O
The	O
Group	O
recognises	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
(	O
‘	O
ECLs	O
’	O
)	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
and	O
contract	O
assets.	O

The	O
Group	O
measures	O
loss	O
allowances	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
equal	O
to	O
lifetime	O
ECLs	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
the	O
following	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
measured	O
at	O
12-month	O
ECLs	O
:	O
-	O

other	O
debt	O
securities	O
and	O
bank	O
balances	O
for	O
which	O
credit	O
risk	O
(	O
i.e.	O

the	O
risk	O
of	O
default	O
occurring	O
over	O
the	O
expected	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument	O
)	O
has	O
not	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition.	O

Loss	O
allowances	O
for	O
trade	O
receivables	O
and	O
contract	O
assets	O
are	O
always	O
measured	O
at	O
an	O
amount	O
equal	O
to	O
lifetime	O
ECLs.	O

At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
assesses	O
whether	O
financial	O
assets	O
carried	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
and	O
debt	O
securities	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
credit-impaired.	O

Loss	O
allowances	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
are	O
deducted	O
from	O
the	O
gross	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
assets.	O

For	O
debt	O
securities	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
charged	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
and	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

30	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O
NOTE	O
3	O
–	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Impairment	O
(	O
con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Financial	O
assets	O
(	O
con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
The	O
gross	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
is	O
written	O
off	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectations	O
of	O
recovering	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
in	O
its	O
entirety	O
or	O
a	O
portion	O
thereof.	O

Non-financial	O
assets	O
The	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assets	O
,	O
other	O
than	O
deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
,	O
are	O
reviewed	O
at	O
each	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
any	O
indication	O
of	O
impairment.	O

If	O
any	O
such	O
indication	O
exists	O
,	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
estimated.	O

An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
whenever	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
an	O
asset	O
or	O
its	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
exceeds	O
its	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

Impairment	O
losses	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
,	O
unless	O
an	O
asset	O
has	O
previously	O
been	O
revalued	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
the	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
reversal	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
that	O
previous	O
revaluation	O
with	O
any	O
excess	O
recognised	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Calculation	O
of	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
The	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
is	O
the	O
greater	O
of	O
their	O
fair	O
value	O
less	O
costs	O
to	O
sell	O
and	O
value	O
in	O
use.	O

In	O
assessing	O
value	O
in	O
use	O
,	O
the	O
estimated	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
are	O
discounted	O
to	O
their	O
present	O
value	O
using	O
a	O
pre-tax	O
discount	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
asset.	O

For	O
an	O
asset	O
that	O
does	O
not	O
generate	O
largely	O
independent	O
cash	O
inflows	O
,	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
the	O
cash-generating	O
unit	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
belongs.	O

Reversals	O
of	O
impairment	O
An	O
impairment	O
loss	O
is	O
reversed	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
the	O
asset	O
’	O
s	O
carrying	O
amount	O
does	O
not	O
exceed	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
that	O
would	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
depreciation	O
or	O
amortisation	O
,	O
if	O
no	O
impairment	O
loss	O
had	O
been	O
recognised.	O

Share	O
capital	O
Transaction	O
costs	O
Incremental	O
costs	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
an	O
equity	O
transaction	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
as	O
a	O
deduction	O
from	O
equity	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
any	O
related	O
income	O
tax	O
benefit.	O

Dividends	O
Dividends	O
are	O
recognised	O
as	O
a	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
period	O
in	O
which	O
they	O
are	O
declared.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
Trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
at	O
their	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

Trade	O
payables	O
are	O
non-interest	O
bearing	O
and	O
are	O
normally	O
settled	O
on	O
30	O
day	O
terms.	O

Expenses	O
Net	O
financing	O
income	O
Net	O
financing	O
costs	O
comprise	O
interest	O
payable	O
on	O
borrowings	O
calculated	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method	O
,	O
interest	O
earned	O
and	O
foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses.	O

Interest	O
income	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
as	O
it	O
accrues	O
,	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

Dividend	O
income	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
on	O
the	O
date	O
the	O
entity	O
’	O
s	O
right	O
to	O
receive	O
payment	O
is	O
established.	O

PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Equity	O
settled	O
share	O
based	O
payments	O
The	O
grant-date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
equity	O
settled	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
awards	O
granted	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
administration	O
and	O
consultants	O
’	O
expense	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
corresponding	O
increase	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
that	O
the	O
employee	O
becomes	O
unconditionally	O
entitled	O
to	O
the	O
awards.	O

The	O
amount	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
adjusted	O
to	O
reflect	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
for	O
which	O
the	O
related	O
service	O
and	O
non-market	O
vesting	O
conditions	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
met	O
,	O
such	O
that	O
the	O
amount	O
ultimately	O
recognised	O
as	O
an	O
expense	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
awards	O
that	O
meet	O
the	O
related	O
service	O
and	O
non-market	O
performance	O
conditions	O
at	O
vesting	O
date.	O

For	O
market	O
conditions	O
and	O
non-vesting	O
conditions	O
,	O
the	O
grant	O
date	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
share	O
based	O
payment	O
is	O
measured	O
to	O
reflect	O
such	O
conditions	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
true-up	O
for	O
differences	O
between	O
expected	O
and	O
actual	O
outcomes.	O

Borrowings	O
Borrowings	O
are	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
net	O
of	O
transaction	O
costs	O
incurred.	O

Borrowings	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost.	O

Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
proceeds	O
(	O
net	O
of	O
transaction	O
costs	O
)	O
and	O
the	O
redemption	O
amount	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
over	O
the	O
period	O
of	O
the	O
borrowings	O
using	O
the	O
effective	O
interest	O
method.	O

Borrowings	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
current	O
liabilities	O
unless	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
an	O
unconditional	O
right	O
to	O
defer	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
liability	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
12	O
months	O
after	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date.	O

Borrowing	O
costs	O
which	O
are	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
and	O
development	O
activities	O
are	O
capitalised	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
qualifying	O
assets.	O

Income	O
tax	O
Income	O
tax	O
on	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
for	O
the	O
year	O
comprises	O
current	O
and	O
deferred	O
tax.	O

Income	O
tax	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
income	O
statement	O
except	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
relates	O
to	O
items	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
equity	O
,	O
in	O
which	O
case	O
it	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
equity.	O

Current	O
tax	O
is	O
the	O
expected	O
tax	O
payable	O
on	O
the	O
taxable	O
income	O
for	O
the	O
period	O
,	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantially	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date	O
,	O
and	O
any	O
adjustment	O
to	O
tax	O
payable	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
previous	O
periods.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
is	O
provided	O
using	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
liability	O
method	O
,	O
providing	O
for	O
temporary	O
differences	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amounts	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
for	O
financial	O
reporting	O
purposes	O
and	O
the	O
amounts	O
used	O
for	O
taxation	O
purposes.	O

The	O
following	O
temporary	O
differences	O
are	O
not	O
provided	O
for	O
:	O
-	O

the	O
initial	O
recognition	O
of	O
assets	O
or	O
liabilities	O
that	O
affect	O
neither	O
accounting	O
nor	O
taxable	O
profit	O
and	O
differences	O
relating	O
to	O
investments	O
in	O
subsidiaries	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
they	O
will	O
probably	O
not	O
reverse	O
in	O
the	O
foreseeable	O
future	O
;	O
and	O
-	O

the	O
amount	O
of	O
deferred	O
tax	O
provided	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
expected	O
manner	O
of	O
realisation	O
or	O
settlement	O
of	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
,	O
using	O
tax	O
rates	O
enacted	O
or	O
substantively	O
enacted	O
at	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
date.	O

A	O
deferred	O
tax	O
asset	O
is	O
recognised	O
only	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
future	O
taxable	O
profits	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
against	O
which	O
the	O
asset	O
can	O
be	O
utilised.	O

Deferred	O
tax	O
assets	O
are	O
reduced	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
no	O
longer	O
probable	O
that	O
the	O
related	O
tax	O
benefit	O
will	O
be	O
realised.	O

32	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O
controlled	O
entities	O
NOTES	O
TO	O
THE	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENTS	O
FOR	O
THE	O
YEAR	O
ENDED	O
31	O
DECEMBER	O
2021	O

3	O
–	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
Revenue	O
,	O
expenses	O
and	O
assets	O
are	O
recognised	O
net	O
of	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
goods	O
and	O
services	O
tax	O
(	O
‘	O
GST	O
’	O
)	O
,	O
except	O
where	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
incurred	O
is	O
not	O
recoverable	O
from	O
the	O
taxation	O
authority.	O

In	O
these	O
circumstances	O
,	O
the	O
GST	O
is	O
recognised	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
cost	O
of	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
asset	O
or	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
expense.	O

Receivables	O
and	O
payables	O
are	O
stated	O
with	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
included.	O

The	O
net	O
amount	O
of	O
GST	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
is	O
included	O
as	O
a	O
current	O
asset	O
or	O
liability	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position.	O

Cash	O
flows	O
are	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
on	O
a	O
gross	O
basis.	O

The	O
GST	O
components	O
of	O
cash	O
flows	O
arising	O
from	O
investing	O
and	O
financing	O
activities	O
which	O
are	O
recoverable	O
from	O
,	O
or	O
payable	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
Australian	O
Taxation	O
Office	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
operating	O
cash	O
flows.	O

Segment	O
Reporting	O
Determination	O
and	O
presentation	O
of	O
operating	O
segments	O
The	O
Group	O
determines	O
and	O
presents	O
operating	O
segments	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
provided	O
internally	O
to	O
Executive	O
Director	O
and	O
the	O
CFO	O
,	O
who	O
are	O
the	O
Group's	O
chief	O
operating	O
decision	O
makers.	O

An	O
operating	O
segment	O
is	O
a	O
component	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
that	O
engages	O
in	O
business	O
activities	O
from	O
which	O
it	O
may	O
earn	O
revenues	O
and	O
incur	O
expenses	O
,	O
including	O
revenues	O
and	O
expenses	O
that	O
relate	O
to	O
transactions	O
with	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
Group's	O
other	O
components.	O

All	O
operating	O
segments'	O
operating	O
results	O
are	O
regularly	O
reviewed	O
by	O
the	O
Group's	O
Executive	O
Directors	O
to	O
make	O
decisions	O
about	O
resources	O
to	O
be	O
allocated	O
to	O
the	O
segment	O
and	O
assess	O
its	O
performance	O
,	O
and	O
for	O
which	O
discrete	O
financial	O
information	O
is	O
available.	O

Segment	O
results	O
that	O
are	O
reported	O
to	O
Executive	O
Directors	O
include	O
items	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
segment	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
those	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
allocated	O
on	O
a	O
reasonable	O
basis.	O

Unallocated	O
items	O
comprise	O
mainly	O
corporate	O
assets	O
(	O
primarily	O
the	O
Company's	O
headquarters	O
)	O
and	O
head	O
office	O
expenses.	O

Segment	O
capital	O
expenditure	O
is	O
the	O
total	O
cost	O
incurred	O
during	O
the	O
period	O
to	O
acquire	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
,	O
and	O
intangible	O
assets	O
other	O
than	O
goodwill.	O

Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
Cash	O
and	O
cash	O
equivalents	O
comprise	O
cash	O
balances	O
and	O
call	O
deposits	O
with	O
an	O
original	O
maturity	O
of	O
three	O
months	O
or	O
less.	O

Employee	O
benefits	O
Wages	O
,	O
salaries	O
,	O
annual	O
leave	O
,	O
sick	O
leave	O
and	O
non-monetary	O
benefits	O
Liabilities	O
for	O
employee	O
benefits	O
for	O
wages	O
,	O
salaries	O
,	O
annual	O
leave	O
and	O
sick	O
leave	O
that	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
settled	O
within	O
12	O
months	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
represent	O
present	O
obligations	O
resulting	O
from	O
employees'	O
services	O
provided	O
to	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
are	O
calculated	O
at	O
undiscounted	O
amounts	O
based	O
on	O
remuneration	O
wage	O
and	O
salary	O
rates	O
that	O
the	O
Group	O
expects	O
to	O
pay	O
as	O
at	O
reporting	O
date	O
and	O
payroll	O
tax.	O

Provisions	O
A	O
provision	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
balance	O
sheet	O
when	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
a	O
present	O
legal	O
or	O
constructive	O
obligation	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
past	O
event	O
,	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
probable	O
that	O
an	O
outflow	O
of	O
economic	O
benefits	O
will	O
be	O
required	O
to	O
settle	O
the	O
obligation.	O

If	O
the	O
effect	O
is	O
material	O
,	O
provisions	O
are	O
determined	O
by	O
discounting	O
the	O
expected	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
at	O
a	O
pre-tax	O
rate	O
that	O
reflects	O
current	O
market	O
assessments	O
of	O
the	O
time	O
value	O
of	O
money	O
and	O
,	O
when	O
appropriate	O
,	O
the	O
risks	O
specific	O
to	O
the	O
liability.	O

33	O
PROSPECH	O
LIMITED	O
and	O
its	O

entities	O

3	O

SIGNIFICANT	O
ACCOUNTING	O
POLICIES	O
(	O
Con	O
’	O
t	O
)	O
Site	O
restoration	O
In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
environmental	O
policy	O
and	O
applicable	O
legal	O
requirements	O
,	O
a	O
provision	O
for	O
site	O
restoration	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
disturbed	O
land	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
related	O
expense	O
,	O
is	O
recognised	O
when	O
the	O
land	O
is	O
disturbed.	O

Determination	O
of	O
fair	O
values	O
A	O
number	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
accounting	O
policies	O
and	O
disclosures	O
require	O
the	O
determination	O
of	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
for	O
both	O
financial	O
and	O
non-	O
financial	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities.	O

Fair	O
values	O
have	O
been	O
determined	O
for	O
measurement	O
and/or	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
following	O
methods.	O

Where	O
applicable	O
,	O
further	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
assumptions	O
made	O
in	O
determining	O
fair	O
values	O
is	O
disclosed	O
in	O
the	O
notes	O
specific	O
to	O
that	O
asset	O
or	O
liability.	O

Trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
The	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
receivables	O
is	O
estimated	O
as	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
market	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

Non-derivative	O
financial	O
liabilities	O
Fair	O
value	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
determined	O
for	O
disclosure	O
purposes	O
,	O
is	O
calculated	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
future	O
principal	O
and	O
interest	O
cash	O
flows	O
,	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
market	O
rate	O
of	O
interest	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

Exploration	O
,	O
evaluation	O
and	O
development	O
expenditure	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
costs	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
costs	O
of	O
acquiring	O
licences	O
,	O
are	O
capitalised	O
at	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
,	O
as	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
on	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
basis.	O

Costs	O
incurred	O
before	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
obtained	O
the	O
legal	O
rights	O
to	O
explore	O
an	O
area	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
only	O
recognised	O
if	O
the	O
rights	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
current	O
and	O
either	O
:	O
-	O

the	O
expenditures	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
be	O
recouped	O
through	O
successful	O
development	O
and	O
exploitation	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
;	O
or	O
-	O

activities	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
have	O
not	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
reached	O
a	O
stage	O
which	O
permits	O
a	O
reasonable	O
assessment	O
of	O
the	O
existence	O
or	O
otherwise	O
of	O
economically	O
recoverable	O
reserves	O
and	O
active	O
and	O
significant	O
operations	O
in	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
,	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
continuing.	O

Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
assessed	O
for	O
impairment	O
if	O
sufficient	O
data	O
exists	O
to	O
determine	O
technical	O
feasibility	O
and	O
commercial	O
viability	O
and	O
facts	O
and	O
circumstances	O
suggest	O
that	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
exceeds	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount.	O

For	O
the	O
purposes	O
of	O
impairment	O
testing	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
are	O
allocated	O
to	O
cash-generating	O
units	O
to	O
which	O
the	O
exploration	O
activity	O
relates.	O

The	O
cash	O
generating	O
unit	O
shall	O
not	O
be	O
larger	O
than	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
interest.	O

Once	O
the	O
technical	O
feasibility	O
and	O
commercial	O
viability	O
of	O
the	O
extraction	O
of	O
mineral	O
resources	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
demonstrable	O
,	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
attributable	O
to	O
that	O
area	O
of	O
interest	O
are	O
first	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
and	O
then	O
reclassified	O
from	O
exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O
to	O
mining	O
property	O
and	O
development	O
assets	O
within	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment.	O

The	O
Company	O
has	O
an	O
executive	O
option	O
plan	O
(	O
‘	O
Plan	O
’	O
)	O
that	O
entitles	O
eligible	O
employees	O
including	O
the	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
to	O
be	O
granted	O
options	O
in	O
the	O
Company.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
service	O
nor	O
performance	O
conditions	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
options	O
issued	O
during	O
the	O
period.	O

Options	O
issued	O
are	O
not	O
dependent	O
on	O
the	O
satisfaction	O
of	O
any	O
performance	O
condition	O
,	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
difficulty	O
in	O
setting	O
appropriate	O
performance	O
criteria	O
for	O
all	O
parties	O
at	O
this	O
stage	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
development.	O

Ordinary	O
shares	O
The	O
Company	O
does	O
not	O
have	O
authorised	O
capital	O
or	O
par	O
value	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
its	O
issued	O
shares.	O

All	O
issued	O
shares	O
are	O
fully	O
paid.	O

The	O
holders	O
of	O
ordinary	O
shares	O
are	O
entitled	O
to	O
voting	O
rights	O
and	O
receive	O
dividends	O
as	O
declared	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time.	O

Nature	O
and	O
purpose	O
of	O
reserves	O
Acquisition	O
reserve	O
The	O
acquisition	O
reserve	O
reflects	O
the	O
transaction	O
with	O
the	O
non-controlling	O
interest	O
following	O
the	O
acquisition	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
of	O
an	O
additional	O
30%	O
interest	O
in	O
Slovenske	O
Kovy	O
s.r.o	O
(	O
‘	O
SLOK	O
’	O
)	O
on	O
completion	O
of	O
tranche	O
3	O
on	O
31	O
December	O
2016	O
and	O
the	O
remaining	O
19%	O
in	O
October	O
2017.	O

Foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
The	O
foreign	O
currency	O
translation	O
reserve	O
records	O
the	O
foreign	O
currency	O
differences	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
translation	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
where	O
their	O
functional	O
currency	O
is	O
different	O
to	O
the	O
presentation	O
currency	O
of	O
the	O
reporting	O
entity.	O

Option	O
premium	O
reserve	O

option	O

FINANCIAL	O
RISK	O
MANAGEMENT	O
AND	O
FINANCIAL	O
INSTRUMENTS	O
DISCLOSURE	O
The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
comprise	O
deposits	O
with	O
banks	O
,	O
receivables	O
,	O
trade	O
and	O
other	O
payables	O
and	O
from	O
time	O
to	O
time	O
short	O
term	O
loans	O
from	O
related	O
parties.	O

The	O
Group	O
does	O
not	O
trade	O
in	O
derivatives.	O

The	O
main	O
risks	O
arising	O
from	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
financial	O
instruments	O
are	O
credit	O
risk	O
,	O
liquidity	O
risk	O
,	O
currency	O
risk	O
and	O
interest	O
rate	O
risk.	O

The	O
summaries	O
below	O
present	O
information	O
about	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
exposure	O
to	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
risks	O
,	O
their	O
objectives	O
,	O
policies	O
and	O
processes	O
for	O
measuring	O
and	O
managing	O
risk	O

the	O
management	O
of	O
capital	O
and	O
financial	O
instruments.	O

Risk	O
management	O
framework	O
The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
has	O
overall	O
responsibility	O
for	O
the	O
establishment	O
and	O
oversight	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
management	O
framework.	O

Risk	O
management	O
policies	O
are	O
established	O
to	O
identify	O
and	O
analyse	O
the	O
risks	O
faced	O
by	O
the	O
Group	O
,	O
to	O
set	O
appropriate	O
risk	O
limits	O
and	O
controls	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
monitor	O
risks	O
and	O
adherence	O
to	O
limits.	O

These	O
policies	O
are	O
reviewed	O
regularly	O
to	O
reflect	O
changes	O
in	O
market	O
conditions	O
and	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
activities.	O

The	O
primary	O
responsibility	O
to	O
monitor	O
the	O
financial	O
risks	O
lies	O
with	O
the	O
Managing	O
Director	O
and	O
the	O
Company	O

under	O
the	O
authority	O
of	O

Capital	O
management	O

of	O

FINANCIAL	O

SEGMENTS	O
Segment	O
results	O
,	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
include	O

directly	O

to	O
a	O
segment	O
as	O

as	O
those	O
that	O
can	O

a	O

basis.	O

items	O
relate	O
to	O

operations	O
in	O
Australia	O

and	O

and	O
corporate	O
assets	O
and	O
expenses.	O

Segment	O
capital	O
expenditure	O
is	O
the	O
total	O
cost	O
incurred	O
during	O
the	O
period	O
to	O

segment	O
assets	O
that	O
are	O

to	O

used	O
for	O
more	O
than	O

in	O
that	O

region.	O

53	O
Material	O
uncertainty	O
relating	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
We	O
draw	O
attention	O
to	O
Note	O
2	O
,	O
“	O
Going	O
Concern	O
”	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O

The	O
conditions	O
disclosed	O
in	O
Note	O
2	O
,	O
indicate	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
exists	O
that	O
may	O
cast	O
significant	O
doubt	O
on	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
ability	O
to	O
continue	O
as	O
a	O
going	O
concern	O
and	O
,	O
therefore	O
,	O
whether	O
it	O
will	O
realise	O
its	O
assets	O
and	O
discharge	O
its	O
liabilities	O
in	O
the	O
normal	O
course	O
of	O
business	O
,	O
and	O
at	O
the	O
amounts	O
stated	O
in	O
the	O
financial	O
report.	O

Our	O
opinion	O
is	O
not	O
modified	O
in	O
respect	O
of	O
this	O
matter.	O

In	O
concluding	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
material	O
uncertainty	O
related	O
to	O
going	O
concern	O
we	O
evaluated	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
uncertainty	O
regarding	O
events	O
or	O
conditions	O
casting	O
significant	O
doubt	O
in	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
assessment	O
of	O
going	O
concern.	O

This	O
included	O
:	O
	O

Analysing	O
the	O
cash	O
flow	O
projections	O
by	O
:	O
-	O

Evaluating	O
the	O
underlying	O
data	O
used	O
to	O
generate	O
the	O
projections	O
for	O
consistency	O
with	O
other	O
information	O
tested	O
by	O
us	O
,	O
our	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
intentions	O
,	O
and	O
past	O
results	O
and	O
practices	O
;	O
-	O

Assessing	O
the	O
planned	O
levels	O
of	O
operating	O
and	O
capital	O
expenditures	O
for	O
consistency	O
of	O
relationships	O
and	O
trends	O
to	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
historical	O
results	O
,	O
results	O
since	O
year	O
end	O
,	O
and	O
our	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
business	O
,	O
industry	O
and	O
economic	O
conditions	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
;	O
	O

Assessing	O
significant	O
non-routine	O
forecast	O
cash	O
inflows	O
and	O
outflows	O
,	O
including	O
the	O
expected	O
impact	O
of	O
planned	O
capital	O
raisings	O
for	O
feasibility	O
,	O
quantum	O
and	O
timing.	O

We	O
used	O
our	O
knowledge	O
of	O
the	O
client	O
,	O
its	O
industry	O
and	O
current	O
status	O
of	O
those	O
initiatives	O
to	O
assess	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
associated	O
uncertainty.	O

	O

Reading	O
minutes	O
of	O
Directors	O
’	O
meetings	O
and	O
relevant	O

with	O

’	O
s	O

Other	O

Report.	O

The	O
Directors	O
are	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
Other	O
Information.	O

Our	O
opinion	O
on	O
the	O
Financial	O
Report	O
does	O
not	O
cover	O
the	O
Other	O
Information	O
and	O
,	O
accordingly	O
,	O
we	O
do	O
not	O
express	O
an	O
audit	O

or	O
any	O

of	O
assurance	O
conclusion	O
thereon	O

and	O
our	O
related	O
assurance	O
opinion.	O

our	O
audit	O
of	O
the	O

our	O

is	O
to	O

Other	O
Information.	O

In	O

so	O
,	O
we	O
consider	O
whether	O

Other	O
Information	O
is	O

in	O
the	O
audit	O

or	O
otherwise	O

misstated.	O

Misstatements	O

fraud	O
or	O
error.	O

are	O

material	O
if	O

or	O

1	O
Chairman	O
’	O
s	O
Address	O
Dear	O
Shareholders	O
Following	O
the	O
delivery	O
in	O
May	O
2020	O
of	O
our	O
upgraded	O
mineral	O
resource	O
to	O
1m	O
oz1	O
,	O
the	O
company	O
raised	O
approximately	O
$15	O
million	O
and	O
commenced	O
a	O
drilling	O
program	O
to	O
further	O
build	O
on	O
that	O
resource	O
base	O
to	O
reach	O
“	O
critical	O
mass	O
”	O
both	O
in	O
overall	O
mineable	O
gold	O
inventory	O
,	O
and	O
mineable	O
tonnage	O
to	O
increase	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
mine	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
complete	O
our	O
mining	O
proposal.	O

The	O
initial	O
drilling	O
program	O
began	O
in	O
September	O
2020	O
and	O
resulted	O
in	O
the	O
final	O
results	O
being	O
received	O
in	O
January	O
2021.	O

I	O
encourage	O
you	O
to	O
read	O
the	O
Review	O
of	O
Operations	O
section	O
of	O
this	O
report	O
for	O
further	O
detail.	O

The	O
results	O
of	O
this	O
drilling	O
program	O
permitted	O
planning	O
to	O
commence	O
for	O
the	O
2021	O

program	O
which	O
was	O
to	O
focus	O
on	O

additional	O
open	O
pit	O
material	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
defining	O
which	O
of	O
the	O
eleven	O
priority	O
pits	O
would	O
be	O
the	O
potential	O
contender	O
for	O
the	O
first	O
of	O
the	O
pits	O
to	O
be	O
mined.	O

On	O
behalf	O
of	O
the	O
The	O
Company	O
completed	O
a	O
small	O
capital	O
raising	O
in	O
June	O
of	O
this	O
year	O
Board	O

gives	O
me	O
raising	O
$6m	O
in	O

to	O

in	O
the	O

of	O

current	O

great	O

to	O
program.	O

of	O
2021	O

has	O
been	O

at	O
all	O

pits	O
selected	O

Report	O
for	O
the	O
On	O
the	O
corporate	O
front	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
considered	O
a	O
range	O

2021	O

year.	O

merger	O
and	O

options	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
have	O
not	O
yet	O
found	O
a	O
suitable	O

that	O
would	O

s	O

Your	O

of	O
the	O
quality	O
of	O
Vango	O
’	O
s	O
tenement	O
holding	O
and	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O

opportunities	O
that	O
protect	O
and	O

that	O

was	O

to	O
welcome	O

Craig	O
Wallace	O
to	O

Wallace	O
has	O

to	O
our	O
board	O
both	O
from	O
his	O
experience	O
within	O

of	O

Company	O
Strategy	O
Vango	O
’	O
s	O
vision	O
is	O
to	O
build	O
a	O
sustainable	O
,	O
mid-tier	O
gold	O
production	O
company.	O

Vango	O
is	O
progressing	O
a	O
deliberate	O
strategy	O
of	O
growing	O
its	O
high-	O
Grow	O
our	O
grade	O
gold	O
endowment	O
to	O
support	O
its	O
ambitions	O
of	O
becoming	O
Resource	O
a	O
significant	O
high-grade	O
Western	O
Australian	O
gold	O
miner.	O

Our	O
exploration	O
programme	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
expand	O

Remuneration	O
Philosophy	O
The	O
remuneration	O
report	O
details	O
the	O
remuneration	O
arrangements	O
for	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
(	O
KMP	O
)	O
who	O
are	O
defined	O
as	O
those	O
having	O
authority	O
and	O
responsibility	O
for	O
planning	O
,	O
directing	O
and	O
controlling	O
the	O
major	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
directly	O
or	O
indirectly	O
,	O
including	O
any	O
director	O
(	O
whether	O
executive	O
or	O
otherwise	O
)	O
.	O

Key	O
management	O
personnel	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
comprise	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
only.	O

The	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
depends	O
upon	O
the	O
quality	O
of	O
its	O
key	O
management	O
personnel.	O

To	O
prosper	O
the	O
Company	O
must	O
attract	O
,	O
motivate	O
and	O
retain	O
appropriately	O
skilled	O
directors	O
and	O
executives.	O

The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
broad	O
remuneration	O
policy	O
is	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
remuneration	O
package	O
rewards	O
performance	O
,	O
properly	O
reflects	O
the	O
person	O
’	O
s	O
duties	O
and	O
responsibilities	O
and	O
is	O
competitive	O
in	O
attracting	O
,	O
retaining	O
and	O
motivating	O
people	O
of	O
the	O
highest	O
quality.	O

B.	O

Remuneration	O
Structure	O
and	O
Approvals	O
Remuneration	O
is	O
set	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors.	O

The	O
Board	O
has	O
established	O
a	O
separate	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
to	O
make	O
recommendations	O
to	O
the	O
Board.	O

During	O
the	O
financial	O
year	O
the	O
Board	O
engaged	O
the	O
services	O
of	O
a	O
remuneration	O
consultant	O
to	O
review	O
,	O
provide	O
industry	O
comparisons	O
and	O
independently	O
recommend	O
remuneration	O
levels	O
,	O
for	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
to	O
rely	O
on	O
when	O
making	O
recommendations	O
to	O
the	O
Board	O
for	O
setting	O
Directors	O
’	O
remuneration.	O

Executive	O
Remuneration	O
Structure	O
The	O
Company	O
aims	O
to	O
reward	O
executives	O
with	O
a	O
level	O
and	O
mix	O
of	O
remuneration	O
commensurate	O
with	O
their	O
position	O
and	O
responsibilities	O
within	O
the	O
Company	O
and	O
aligned	O
with	O
market	O
practice.	O

Executive	O
remuneration	O
and	O
incentive	O
policies	O
and	O
practices	O
must	O
:	O
−	O

be	O
aligned	O
with	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
vision	O
,	O
values	O
and	O
overall	O
business	O
objectives	O
;	O
−	O

be	O
designed	O
to	O
motivate	O
the	O
executives	O
to	O
pursue	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
long-term	O
growth	O
and	O
success	O
;	O
and	O
−	O

demonstrate	O
a	O
clear	O
relationship	O
between	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
overall	O
performance	O
and	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
executives.	O

Vango	O
Mining	O
Limited	O
Annual	O
Report	O
2021	O
21	O
The	O
nature	O
and	O
amount	O
of	O
remuneration	O
of	O
executives	O
are	O
assessed	O
on	O
a	O
periodic	O
basis	O
by	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
for	O
Board	O
approval	O
,	O
with	O
the	O
overall	O
objective	O
of	O
ensuring	O
maximum	O
stakeholder	O
benefit	O
from	O
the	O
retention	O
of	O
high	O
performing	O
executives.	O

The	O
main	O
objectives	O
sought	O
when	O
reviewing	O
executive	O
remuneration	O
is	O
that	O
the	O
Company	O
has	O
:	O
−	O

coherent	O
remuneration	O
policies	O
and	O
practices	O
to	O
attract	O
and	O
retain	O
executives	O
;	O
−	O

executives	O
who	O
will	O
create	O
value	O
for	O
shareholders	O
−	O

competitive	O
remuneration	O
offered	O
benchmarked	O
against	O
the	O
external	O
market	O
;	O
and	O
−	O

fair	O
and	O
responsible	O
rewards	O
to	O
executives	O
having	O
regard	O
to	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
,	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
executives	O
and	O
the	O
general	O
pay	O
environment.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
predetermined	O
equity	O
compensation	O
element	O
within	O
the	O
remuneration	O
structure	O
nor	O
are	O
there	O

conditions	O
to	O
be	O
satisfied.	O

All	O
directors	O
(	O

to	O

’	O

in	O

and	O

“	O

Non-Executive	O
Remuneration	O
Structure	O
The	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
are	O
remunerated	O
by	O
way	O
of	O
fees	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
cash	O
,	O
non-cash	O
benefits	O
and	O
superannuation	O
contributions.	O

The	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
intention	O
is	O
to	O
remunerate	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
at	O
market	O
rates	O
for	O
time	O
,	O
commitment	O
and	O
responsibilities.	O

The	O
Board	O
of	O
Directors	O
determines	O
the	O
payments	O
to	O
the	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
reviews	O
their	O
remuneration	O
annually	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
market	O
price	O
,	O
duties	O
and	O
accountability.	O

Independent	O
external	O
advice	O
is	O
sought	O
when	O
required.	O

The	O
maximum	O
aggregate	O
fee	O
pool	O
to	O
be	O
paid	O
to	O
Directors	O
(	O
excluding	O
executive	O
directors	O
)	O
is	O
set	O
at	O
$250	O
,	O
000	O
per	O
year	O
(	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Constitution	O
)	O
and	O
as	O
approved	O
by	O
the	O
shareholders	O
of	O
the	O
Company.	O

Non-executive	O
directors	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
share-based	O
incentive	O
plans	O
and	O
encouraged	O
to	O
hold	O
shares	O
,	O
to	O
align	O
directors	O
’	O
interests	O
with	O
shareholders	O
’	O
interests.	O

Non-executive	O
directors	O
may	O
enter	O
into	O
separate	O
consultancy	O
mandates	O
with	O
the	O
Company	O
for	O
the	O
provision	O
of	O
professional	O
and	O
technical	O
services	O
that	O
fall	O
outside	O
the	O
scope	O
of	O
their	O
directorship	O
role.	O

Under	O
this	O
mandate	O
directors	O
receive	O
a	O
consultancy	O
fee	O
in	O
connection	O
with	O
time	O
spent	O
on	O
Company	O
business	O
,	O
including	O
reasonable	O
expenses	O
incurred	O
by	O
them	O
in	O
carrying	O
out	O
this	O
consultancy	O
role.	O

E.	O

Share-based	O
Compensation	O
The	O
Company	O
rewards	O
Directors	O
for	O
their	O
performance	O
and	O
aligns	O
their	O
remuneration	O
with	O
the	O
creation	O
of	O
shareholder	O
wealth	O
by	O
issuing	O
share	O
options	O
and	O
shares.	O

Share-based	O
compensation	O
is	O
at	O
the	O
discretion	O
of	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
no	O
individual	O
has	O
a	O
contractual	O
right	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
any	O
share-based	O
plan	O
or	O
to	O
receive	O
any	O
guaranteed	O
benefits.	O

Options	O
The	O
Company	O
issued	O
performance	O
options	O
on	O
18	O
June	O
2019	O
to	O
key	O
management	O
personnel	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
remuneration.	O

These	O
performance	O
options	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O

Shares	O
At	O
the	O
General	O
Meeting	O
of	O
shareholders	O
held	O
on	O
27	O
August	O
2018	O
,	O
shareholders	O
approved	O
the	O
establishment	O
of	O
the	O
Vango	O
Mining	O
Share	O
Plan	O
(	O
‘	O
Share	O
Plan	O
’	O
)	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
ASX	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
7.2	O
and	O
sections	O
259B	O
(	O
2	O
)	O
and	O
260c	O
(	O
4	O
)	O
of	O
the	O
Corporations	O
Act.	O

Under	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
,	O
eligible	O
participants	O
are	O
provided	O
with	O
a	O
non-recourse	O
loan	O
from	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
fund	O
the	O
subscription	O
price	O
of	O
issued	O
shares	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
of	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan.	O

At	O
the	O
General	O
Meeting	O
of	O
shareholders	O
held	O
on	O
25	O
November	O
2020	O
,	O
shareholders	O
approved	O
the	O
establishment	O
of	O
the	O
Vango	O
Mining	O
Limited	O
Employee	O
Equity	O
Incentive	O
Plan	O
(	O
‘	O
EIP	O
’	O
)	O
in	O
accordance	O
with	O
ASX	O
Listing	O
Rule	O
7.2	O
(	O
exception	O
13	O
)	O
.	O

Eligible	O
participants	O
of	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
may	O
not	O
deal	O
with	O
the	O
shares	O
while	O
the	O
loan	O
remains	O
outstanding.	O

Although	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
shares	O
are	O
shares	O
for	O
legal	O
and	O
taxation	O
purposes	O
,	O
Accounting	O
Standards	O
require	O
they	O
be	O
treated	O
as	O
options	O
for	O
accounting	O
purposes.	O

Their	O
value	O
is	O
the	O
estimated	O
fair	O
value	O
using	O
the	O
Black-Scholes	O
option	O
pricing	O
model	O
which	O
is	O
expensed	O
in	O
the	O
year	O
of	O
issue.	O

In	O
accordance	O
with	O
the	O
terms	O
and	O
conditions	O
of	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
,	O
the	O
shares	O
are	O
under	O
a	O
Company-imposed	O
trading	O
lock	O
until	O
such	O
time	O
as	O
each	O
Director	O
has	O
repaid	O
the	O
loan	O
provided	O
by	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
fund	O
the	O
subscription	O
price	O
for	O
shares	O
issued	O
to	O
them.	O

It	O
is	O
at	O
the	O
Board	O
’	O
s	O
discretion	O
whether	O
to	O
seek	O
early	O
repayment	O
of	O
the	O
loan	O
should	O
the	O
Director	O
cease	O
to	O
be	O
employed	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O

235	O
Link	O
to	O
Performance	O
Shares	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
Share	O
Plan	O
are	O
treated	O
as	O
options	O
for	O
accounting	O
purposes	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
performance	O
requirements	O
to	O
be	O
met	O
before	O
exercise	O
can	O
take	O
place	O
largely	O
because	O
by	O
setting	O
the	O
option	O
price	O
or	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
a	O
level	O
above	O
the	O
current	O
share	O
price	O
at	O
the	O
time	O
the	O
options	O
or	O
shares	O
are	O
granted	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
considers	O
this	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
sufficient	O
,	O
long-term	O
incentive	O
to	O
align	O
the	O
goals	O
of	O
the	O
Directors	O
and	O
management	O
with	O
those	O
of	O
the	O
shareholders	O
to	O
improve	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
performance.	O

The	O
Board	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O
monitor	O
this	O
policy	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
it	O
is	O
appropriate	O
for	O
the	O
Company	O
in	O
future	O
years.	O

End	O
of	O
remuneration	O
report	O
Vango	O
Mining	O
Limited	O
Annual	O
Report	O
2021	O
27	O
Shares	O
Under	O
Option	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
115	O
,	O
864	O
,	O
406	O
shares	O
under	O
option	O
(	O
2020	O
:	O
141	O
,	O
731	O
,	O
324	O
)	O
.	O

By	O
payment	O
of	O
the	O
exercise	O
price	O
,	O
each	O
option	O
provides	O
the	O
holder	O
with	O
the	O
right	O
to	O
be	O
issued	O
one	O
ordinary	O
fully	O
paid	O
share	O
by	O
the	O
Company.	O

Unless	O
the	O
options	O
are	O
converted	O
into	O
shares	O
with	O
payment	O
of	O
the	O
strike	O
price	O
,	O
no	O
person	O
entitled	O
to	O
exercise	O
these	O
options	O
had	O
or	O
has	O
any	O
right	O
by	O
virtue	O
of	O
the	O
option	O
to	O
participate	O
in	O
any	O
share	O
issue	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
or	O
any	O
related	O
body	O
corporate.	O

Exercise	O
Number	O
1	O
Number	O
Issue	O
Date	O
Price	O

Date	O
July	O

30	O

THE	O

CONSULTING	O
RSM	O
Australia	O
Partners	O
is	O
a	O
member	O
of	O
the	O
RSM	O
network	O
and	O
trades	O
as	O
RSM.	O

RSM	O
is	O
the	O
trading	O
name	O
used	O
by	O
the	O
members	O
of	O
the	O
RSM	O
network.	O

Each	O
member	O
of	O
the	O
RSM	O
network	O
is	O
an	O
independent	O
accounting	O
and	O
consulting	O
firm	O
which	O
practices	O
in	O
its	O
own	O
right.	O

The	O
RSM	O
network	O
is	O
not	O
itself	O
a	O
separate	O
legal	O
entity	O
in	O
any	O
jurisdiction.	O

Australia	O
Partners	O
ABN	O
36	O
965	O

a	O

Vango	O
Mining	O

Annual	O
Report	O
2021	O
Operating	O
and	O
Financial	O
Review	O
Company	O
strategy	O
and	O
operating	O
activities	O
Vango	O
is	O
progressing	O
a	O
deliberate	O
strategy	O
of	O
growing	O
its	O
high-grade	O
gold	O
endowment	O
to	O
support	O
its	O
ambitions	O
of	O
becoming	O
a	O
significant	O
high-grade	O
Western	O
Australian	O
gold	O
miner.	O

Our	O
exploration	O
programme	O
is	O
designed	O
to	O
expand	O
our	O
current	O
1-million-ounce	O
resource	O
,	O
much	O
of	O
which	O
has	O
never	O
been	O
drill	O
tested	O
below	O
200	O
metres.	O

Current	O
drilling	O
is	O
specifically	O
designed	O
to	O
deliver	O
a	O
resource	O
increase	O
(	O
Indicated	O
and	O
Inferred	O
)	O
to	O
the	O
existing	O
Marymia	O
resource	O
base	O
and	O
to	O
enhance	O
the	O
understanding	O
of	O
the	O
mineralised	O
zones	O
within	O
the	O
initial	O
eleven	O
targeted	O
open	O
pits	O
for	O
the	O
benefit	O
of	O
Vango	O
’	O
s	O
mine	O
planning.	O

In	O
the	O
near	O
term	O
,	O
drilling	O
campaigns	O
will	O
be	O
designed	O
to	O
deliver	O
‘	O
critical	O
mass	O
’	O
to	O
increase	O
the	O
mine	O
life	O
of	O
a	O
proposed	O
future	O
mining	O
operation	O
from	O
Marymia	O
’	O
s	O
resource	O
base.	O

They	O
will	O
specifically	O
target	O
increases	O
in	O
total	O
ounces	O
and	O
tonnes	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
mill	O
capacity	O
and	O
Project	O
life	O
of	O
mine	O
are	O
maximised.	O

This	O
allows	O
assessment	O
of	O
appropriate	O
financing	O
levels	O
for	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
proposed	O
stand-alone	O
mining	O
operation.	O

The	O
Plutonic	O
gold	O
mine	O
has	O
produced	O
in	O
excess	O
of	O
5.5moz	O
of	O
gold	O
and	O
sits	O
along	O
strike	O
,	O
immediately	O
to	O
the	O
southwest	O
of	O
the	O
Marymia	O
Project	O
in	O
a	O
geological	O
sequence	O
known	O
as	O
the	O
Mine	O
Mafic.	O

This	O
same	O
geological	O
sequence	O
extends	O
across	O
Marymia	O
and	O
most	O
of	O
it	O
has	O
never	O
been	O
drill	O
tested	O
to	O
depth.	O

of	O

’	O
s	O

has	O

to	O

towards	O

and	O

and	O

of	O

Risk	O

Operating	O
risks	O
The	O
operations	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
may	O

by	O
various	O
factors	O
,	O
including	O
failure	O
to	O
locate	O
or	O

mineral	O
deposits	O
,	O

to	O

predicted	O
grades	O
in	O
exploration	O
and	O
mining	O
,	O

and	O
technical	O
difficulties	O

in	O

and	O

plant	O
and	O

,	O

failure	O
or	O
plant	O
breakdown	O
,	O
unanticipated	O
metallurgical	O
problems	O
which	O
may	O
affect	O
extraction	O
costs	O
,	O
adverse	O
weather	O
conditions	O
,	O
industrial	O
and	O
environmental	O
accidents	O
,	O

and	O

of	O

Environmental	O
risks	O

and	O

Australia	O
and	O
Laos	O

Additional	O

for	O
capital	O

Role	O
of	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
Management	O

the	O
Company	O
on	O

whom	O

to	O

are	O

is	O
responsible	O
for	O
:	O
−	O

,	O

and	O
monitoring	O
implementation	O
of	O
corporate	O

,	O

and	O

;	O
−	O

most	O

;	O
−	O

Composition	O
of	O
the	O
Board	O

Board	O
determines	O
its	O
size	O
and	O
composition	O
,	O
subject	O
to	O
the	O
terms	O
of	O
the	O
Constitution.	O

The	O
Board	O
does	O
not	O

that	O
it	O
should	O
establish	O
a	O
limit	O
on	O
tenure	O
other	O
than	O
stipulated	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
Constitution.	O

While	O

can	O

and	O

Director	O
Independence	O
The	O
Company	O
recognises	O
that	O
independent	O
Directors	O
are	O
important	O
in	O
verifying	O
to	O
shareholders	O
that	O
the	O
Board	O
is	O
properly	O
fulfilling	O
its	O
role	O
and	O
is	O
diligent	O
in	O
holding	O
senior	O
management	O
accountable	O
for	O
its	O
performance.	O

Where	O
practical	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
intended	O
that	O
the	O
Board	O
should	O
comprise	O
a	O
majority	O
of	O
independent	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
and	O
comprise	O
directors	O
with	O
a	O
broad	O
range	O
of	O
qualifications	O
,	O
skills	O
,	O
expertise	O
and	O
experience	O
from	O
a	O
diverse	O
range	O
of	O
backgrounds.	O

Where	O
practical	O
it	O
is	O
also	O
intended	O
that	O
the	O
Chair	O
be	O
an	O
independent	O
non-executive	O
director.	O

Directors	O
of	O
Vango	O
Mining	O
Limited	O
are	O
considered	O
to	O
be	O
independent	O
when	O
they	O
are	O
independent	O
of	O
management	O
and	O
free	O
from	O
any	O
business	O
or	O
other	O
relationship	O
that	O
could	O
materially	O
interfere	O
with	O
,	O
or	O
could	O
reasonably	O
be	O
perceived	O
to	O
materially	O
interfere	O
with	O
,	O
the	O
exercise	O
of	O
their	O
unfettered	O
and	O
independent	O
judgement.	O

The	O
Board	O
has	O
adopted	O
a	O
definition	O
of	O
independence	O
based	O
on	O
that	O
set	O
out	O
in	O
Principle	O
2	O
of	O
the	O
ASX	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
Revise	O
Principles	O
and	O
Recommendations.	O

The	O
Board	O
regularly	O
reviews	O
the	O
independence	O
of	O
each	O
director	O
in	O
light	O
of	O
their	O
interests	O
disclosed	O
to	O
the	O
Board.	O

Appointment	O
to	O
the	O
Board	O
The	O
Board	O
undertakes	O
the	O
role	O
of	O
a	O
Nomination	O
Committee	O
which	O
identifies	O
and	O
recommends	O
potential	O
director	O
appointments.	O

Where	O
a	O
casual	O
vacancy	O
arises	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
has	O
procedures	O
to	O
select	O
the	O
most	O
suitable	O
candidate	O
with	O
the	O
appropriate	O
experience	O
and	O
expertise	O
to	O
ensure	O
a	O
balanced	O
and	O
effective	O
board.	O

Any	O
director	O
appointed	O
during	O
the	O
year	O
to	O
fill	O
a	O
casual	O
vacancy	O
or	O
as	O
an	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
current	O
Board	O
,	O
holds	O
office	O
until	O
the	O
next	O
Annual	O
General	O
Meeting	O
and	O
is	O
then	O
eligible	O
for	O
re-election	O
by	O
the	O
shareholders.	O

a	O

of	O

which	O
sets	O
out	O
the	O
terms	O

that	O

members	O
of	O
the	O
executive	O
team.	O

Mining	O
Limited	O

of	O

,	O

Ethical	O
Business	O
Practices	O
The	O
Board	O
understands	O
the	O

for	O
ethical	O
and	O

All	O

expected	O
to	O
:	O
a	O
)	O

the	O

;	O
b	O
)	O
act	O
in	O

best	O
interests	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
;	O
c	O
)	O
be	O

and	O

for	O

;	O
and	O
d	O
)	O
observe	O
the	O
ethical	O
principles	O
of	O
honesty	O
and	O
fairness	O
,	O
including	O
prompt	O
disclosure	O
of	O
potential	O
conflicts.	O

The	O
Board	O
has	O
procedures	O
in	O
place	O
for	O
reporting	O
any	O
matters	O
that	O
may	O
give	O
rise	O
to	O
unethical	O
practices	O
or	O
conflicts	O
between	O
the	O
interests	O
of	O
a	O
director	O
or	O
senior	O
executive	O
and	O

of	O

Company.	O

are	O
reviewed	O
as	O
required	O
by	O
the	O
Board.	O

Shareholding	O
and	O
Trading	O
The	O
Board	O
encourages	O
directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
to	O
own	O
shares	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
to	O
further	O
link	O
their	O
interests	O
with	O
the	O
interests	O
of	O
all	O
shareholders.	O

Trading	O
of	O
shares	O
by	O
directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
is	O
prohibited	O
under	O
certain	O
circumstances	O
and	O
as	O
described	O
in	O
the	O
ASX	O
Listing	O
Rules	O
and	O
during	O
certain	O
periods	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
year.	O

A	O
director	O
or	O
senior	O
executive	O
must	O
not	O
deal	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
shares	O
at	O
any	O
time	O
when	O
he	O
or	O
she	O
has	O
unpublished	O
information	O
which	O
,	O
if	O
generally	O
available	O
,	O
might	O
affect	O
the	O
share	O
price.	O

Directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
are	O
required	O
to	O
first	O
obtain	O
consent	O
from	O
the	O
Chairman	O
or	O
Company	O
Secretary	O
before	O
dealing	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
securities.	O

Risk	O
Management	O

’	O

”	O

Monitoring	O
Performance	O
The	O
Board	O
and	O
senior	O
executives	O
monitor	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
through	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
management	O
accounts.	O

The	O
management	O
accounts	O
are	O
prepared	O
using	O
accrual	O
accounting	O
and	O
report	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
results.	O

The	O
management	O
accounts	O
are	O
compared	O
to	O
budgets	O
,	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
prepared	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
capital	O
availability	O
and	O
exploration	O
results.	O

The	O
monitoring	O
of	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
performance	O
by	O
the	O
Board	O
and	O
management	O
assists	O
in	O
identifying	O
the	O
correct	O
allocation	O
of	O
resources	O
to	O
maximise	O
the	O
overall	O
return	O
to	O
shareholders.	O

A	O
performance	O
evaluation	O
of	O
executives	O
was	O
not	O
undertaken	O
during	O
the	O
year.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
Board	O
has	O
regularly	O
monitored	O
the	O
performance	O
of	O
both	O
executives	O
on	O
an	O
informal	O
basis	O
during	O
the	O
tenure	O
of	O
their	O
appointments.	O

Remunerate	O
fairly	O
Details	O
of	O

structure	O
of	O

’	O
and	O

Report	O

’	O

in	O
this	O

Report.	O

Committee	O

Messrs	O
Wallace	O
(	O

The	O
role	O
of	O
the	O
Remuneration	O
Committee	O
is	O
to	O
determine	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
remuneration	O
plans	O
,	O
policies	O
and	O
practices	O
,	O
including	O
compensation	O
arrangements	O
for	O
non-executive	O
directors	O
,	O
executive	O
directors	O
and	O
senior	O
executives.	O

It	O
is	O
also	O
responsible	O
for	O
considering	O
general	O
remuneration	O
policies	O
and	O
practices	O
,	O
recruitment	O
and	O
termination	O
policies	O
and	O
superannuation	O
requirements.	O

The	O
Company	O
has	O
a	O
policy	O
to	O
preclude	O
its	O
executives	O
from	O
entering	O
transactions	O
to	O
limit	O
their	O
economic	O
risk	O
from	O
investing	O
in	O
the	O
Company	O
’	O
s	O
shares	O
,	O
options	O
or	O
rights	O
where	O
those	O
investments	O
are	O
unvested	O
and	O
has	O
made	O
executives	O
aware	O
of	O
their	O
obligations	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
financial	O
commitments	O
against	O
shares	O
issued	O
under	O
the	O
share	O
plan	O
and	O
has	O
requested	O
that	O
they	O
take	O
sufficient	O
professional	O
advice	O
in	O
relation	O
to	O
their	O
individual	O
financial	O
position.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
retirement	O
schemes	O
or	O
retirement	O
benefits	O
other	O
than	O
statutory	O
benefits	O
for	O
directors.	O

Gender	O
Diversity	O
The	O
Company	O
has	O
not	O
yet	O
adopted	O
a	O
diversity	O
policy	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
their	O
Corporate	O
Governance	O
Plan.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
Company	O
recognises	O
the	O
benefits	O
arising	O
from	O
board	O
diversity	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
providing	O
a	O
diverse	O
workplace	O
that	O
embraces	O
and	O
promotes	O
diversity.	O

The	O
Company	O
is	O
an	O
equal	O
opportunity	O
employer	O
and	O
chooses	O
candidates	O
after	O
canvassing	O
the	O
market	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
selecting	O
the	O
most	O
appropriate	O
candidate	O
based	O
on	O
merit	O
and	O
suitability	O
for	O
the	O
role.	O

The	O
Company	O
is	O
currently	O
in	O
an	O
early	O
stage	O
of	O
its	O
development	O
and	O
given	O
that	O
the	O
Company	O
currently	O
has	O
few	O
employees	O

application	O
of	O

of	O

to	O

Mining	O

(	O
the	O

the	O

668	O
)	O

,	O
953	O
)	O
incorporated	O
and	O

in	O
Australia	O
whose	O
shares	O
are	O
publicly	O
traded	O
on	O
the	O
Australian	O
Stock	O
Exchange.	O

nature	O
of	O
the	O
operations	O
and	O
principal	O
activities	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
are	O
described	O

Control	O

when	O
the	O
Group	O
is	O
exposed	O
,	O
or	O
has	O

,	O
to	O

are	O
translated	O
into	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
using	O
the	O
exchange	O
rates	O
prevailing	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
with	O
the	O
investee	O
and	O
has	O
the	O
ability	O
to	O
affect	O
those	O
returns	O
through	O
is	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee.	O

Specifically	O
,	O
the	O
of	O
the	O
transactions.	O

Foreign	O
exchange	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
resulting	O
from	O
the	O
settlement	O
of	O
such	O
transactions	O
and	O
from	O
Group	O
controls	O
an	O
investee	O
if	O
and	O
only	O
if	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
:	O
the	O
translation	O
at	O
financial	O
year-end	O
exchange	O
rates	O
of	O
monetary	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
denominated	O
in	O
foreign	O
•	O

Power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
(	O
i.e.	O

existing	O
rights	O
that	O
give	O
it	O
the	O
current	O
ability	O
to	O
direct	O
the	O
relevant	O
activities	O
of	O
currencies	O
are	O

in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

the	O
investee	O
)	O
•	O

Exposure	O
,	O
or	O
rights	O
,	O
to	O
variable	O
returns	O
from	O
its	O
involvement	O
with	O
the	O
invest	O
,	O
and	O
Foreign	O
operations	O
•	O

The	O
ability	O
to	O
use	O
its	O
power	O
over	O
the	O
investee	O
to	O
affect	O
its	O
returns.	O

The	O
assets	O
and	O
liabilities	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
are	O
translated	O
into	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
using	O
the	O
exchange	O
rates	O
at	O
the	O
reporting	O
date.	O

The	O
revenues	O
and	O
expenses	O
of	O
foreign	O
operations	O
are	O
translated	O
into	O
Australian	O
dollars	O
using	O
When	O
the	O
Group	O
has	O
less	O
than	O
a	O
majority	O
of	O
the	O
voting	O
or	O
similar	O
rights	O
of	O
an	O
investee	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
considers	O
all	O
the	O
average	O
exchange	O
rates	O
,	O
which	O
approximate	O
the	O
rates	O
at	O
the	O
dates	O
of	O
the	O
transactions	O
,	O

(	O
n	O
)	O
Investments	O

assets	O

Investments	O

fair	O
value.	O

Transaction	O

are	O

as	O
part	O
(	O
k	O
)	O

and	O

for	O

other	O

,	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O

highly	O

months	O
or	O

of	O
cash	O
and	O
which	O
are	O

to	O
an	O

of	O
changes	O
in	O
value.	O

Financial	O
assets	O

to	O

of	O

is	O
no	O
(	O
l	O
)	O
Trade	O
and	O

or	O

of	O

it's	O

off.	O

Financial	O
assets	O

or	O

for	O

(	O

)	O

(	O
m	O
)	O
Investment	O
in	O
joint	O
ventures	O
A	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
a	O
type	O
of	O
joint	O
arrangement	O
whereby	O
the	O
parties	O
that	O
have	O
joint	O
control	O
of	O
the	O
arrangement	O
have	O
rights	O
to	O
the	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture.	O

Joint	O
control	O
is	O
the	O
contractually	O
agreed	O
sharing	O
of	O
control	O
of	O
an	O
arrangement	O
,	O
which	O
exists	O
only	O
when	O
decisions	O
about	O
the	O
relevant	O
activities	O
require	O
unanimous	O
consent	O
of	O
the	O
parties	O
sharing	O
control.	O

The	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
investment	O
in	O
joint	O
venture	O
are	O
accounted	O
for	O
using	O
the	O
equity	O
method.	O

Under	O
the	O
equity	O
method	O
,	O
the	O
investment	O
in	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
initially	O
recognised	O
at	O
cost.	O

The	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
investment	O
is	O
adjusted	O
to	O
recognise	O
changes	O
in	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
net	O
assets	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
since	O
the	O
acquisition	O
date.	O

Goodwill	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
investment	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
tested	O
for	O
impairment	O
separately.	O

The	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
reflects	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
share	O
of	O
the	O
results	O
of	O
operations	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture.	O

Any	O
change	O
in	O
OCI	O
of	O
those	O
investees	O
is	O
presented	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O
s	O
OCI.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
when	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
a	O
change	O
recognised	O
directly	O
in	O
the	O
equity	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
recognises	O
its	O
share	O
of	O
any	O
changes	O
,	O
when	O
applicable	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
changes	O
in	O
equity.	O

Unrealised	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
resulting	O
from	O
transactions	O
between	O
the	O
Group	O
and	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
are	O
eliminated	O
to	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
the	O
interest	O
in	O
the	O
joint	O
venture.	O

aggregate	O
of	O
the	O
Group	O
’	O

share	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
of	O
a	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O

the	O

of	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O

non-controlling	O
interests	O
in	O
the	O
subsidiaries	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture.	O

The	O
financial	O
statements	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
are	O
prepared	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
the	O
Group.	O

When	O
necessary	O
,	O
adjustments	O
are	O
made	O
to	O
bring	O
the	O
accounting	O
policies	O
in	O
line	O
with	O
those	O
of	O
the	O
Group.	O

After	O
application	O
of	O
the	O
equity	O
method	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
determines	O
whether	O
it	O
is	O
necessary	O
to	O
recognise	O
an	O
impairment	O
loss	O
on	O
its	O
investment	O
in	O
its	O
joint	O
venture.	O

At	O
each	O
reporting	O
date	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
determines	O
whether	O
there	O
is	O
objective	O
evidence	O
that	O
the	O
investment	O
in	O
joint	O
venture	O
is	O
impaired.	O

If	O
there	O
is	O
such	O
evidence	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
calculates	O
the	O
amount	O
of	O
impairment	O
as	O
the	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
recoverable	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
and	O
its	O
carrying	O
value	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
recognises	O
the	O
loss	O
within	O
‘	O
Share	O
of	O
profit	O
of	O
a	O
joint	O
venture	O
’	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Upon	O
loss	O
of	O
significant	O
influence	O
over	O
the	O
joint	O
venture	O
,	O
the	O
Group	O
measures	O
and	O
recognises	O
any	O
retained	O
investment	O
at	O
its	O
fair	O
value.	O

Any	O
difference	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
of	O
the	O
associate	O
or	O
joint	O
venture	O
upon	O
loss	O
of	O
significant	O
influence	O
or	O
joint	O
control	O
and	O
the	O
fair	O
value	O
of	O
the	O
retained	O
investment	O
and	O
proceeds	O
from	O
disposal	O
is	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

(	O
n	O
)	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
Investments	O
and	O
other	O
financial	O
assets	O
are	O
initially	O
measured	O
at	O
fair	O
value.	O

Transaction	O
costs	O
are	O
included	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
measurement	O
,	O
except	O
for	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Such	O
assets	O
are	O
subsequently	O
measured	O
at	O
either	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
depending	O
on	O
their	O
classification.	O

Classification	O
is	O
determined	O
based	O
on	O
both	O
the	O
business	O
model	O
within	O
which	O
such	O
assets	O
are	O
held	O
and	O
the	O
contractual	O
cash	O
flow	O
characteristics	O
of	O
the	O
financial	O
asset	O
unless	O
an	O
accounting	O
mismatch	O
is	O
being	O
avoided.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
are	O
derecognised	O
when	O
the	O
rights	O
to	O
receive	O
cash	O
flows	O
have	O
expired	O
or	O
have	O
been	O
transferred	O
and	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
transferred	O
substantially	O
all	O
the	O
risks	O
and	O
rewards	O
of	O
ownership.	O

When	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reasonable	O
expectation	O
of	O
recovering	O
part	O
or	O
all	O
of	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
,	O
it's	O
carrying	O
value	O
is	O
written	O
off.	O

Financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
Financial	O
assets	O
not	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income	O
are	O
classified	O
as	O
financial	O
assets	O
at	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Typically	O
,	O
such	O
financial	O
assets	O
will	O
be	O
either	O
:	O
(	O
i	O
)	O
held	O
for	O
trading	O
,	O
where	O
they	O
are	O
acquired	O
for	O
the	O
purpose	O
of	O
selling	O
in	O
the	O
short-term	O
with	O
an	O
intention	O
of	O
making	O
a	O
profit	O
,	O
or	O
a	O
derivative	O
;	O
or	O
(	O
ii	O
)	O
designated	O
as	O
such	O
upon	O
initial	O
recognition	O
where	O
permitted.	O

Fair	O
value	O
movements	O
are	O
recognised	O
in	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

62	O

to	O

TO	O
THE	O
CONSOLIDATED	O
FINANCIAL	O
STATEMENT	O
For	O
the	O
year	O
ended	O
30	O
June	O
2021	O
Impairment	O
of	O
financial	O
assets	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
recognises	O
a	O
loss	O
allowance	O
for	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
on	O
financial	O
assets	O
which	O
are	O
either	O
measured	O
at	O
amortised	O
cost	O
or	O
fair	O
value	O
through	O
other	O
comprehensive	O
income.	O

The	O
measurement	O
of	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
depends	O
upon	O
the	O
consolidated	O
entity's	O
assessment	O
at	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
each	O
reporting	O
period	O
as	O
to	O
whether	O
the	O
financial	O
instrument's	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
based	O
on	O
reasonable	O
and	O
supportable	O
information	O
that	O
is	O
available	O
,	O
without	O
undue	O
cost	O
or	O
effort	O
to	O
obtain.	O

Where	O
there	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
a	O
significant	O
increase	O
in	O
exposure	O
to	O
credit	O
risk	O
since	O
initial	O
recognition	O
,	O
a	O
12-month	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
estimated.	O

This	O
represents	O
a	O
portion	O
of	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses	O
that	O
is	O
attributable	O
to	O
a	O
default	O
event	O
that	O
is	O
possible	O
within	O
the	O
next	O
12	O
months.	O

Where	O
a	O
financial	O
asset	O
has	O
become	O
credit	O
impaired	O
or	O
where	O
it	O
is	O
determined	O
that	O
credit	O
risk	O
has	O
increased	O
significantly	O
,	O
the	O
loss	O
allowance	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
the	O
asset's	O
lifetime	O
expected	O
credit	O
losses.	O

The	O
amount	O
of	O
expected	O
credit	O
loss	O
recognised	O
is	O
measured	O
on	O
the	O
basis	O
of	O
the	O
probability	O
weighted	O
present	O
value	O
of	O
anticipated	O
cash	O
shortfalls	O
over	O
the	O
life	O
of	O
the	O
instrument	O
discounted	O
at	O
the	O
original	O
effective	O
interest	O
rate.	O

(	O
o	O

)	O
Property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
Plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
stated	O
at	O
historical	O
cost	O
less	O
accumulated	O
depreciation	O
and	O
impairment.	O

Historical	O
cost	O
includes	O
expenditure	O
that	O
is	O
directly	O
attributable	O
to	O
the	O
acquisition	O
of	O
the	O
items.	O

Depreciation	O
is	O
calculated	O
on	O
a	O
reducing	O
balance	O
basis	O
to	O
write	O
down	O
the	O
net	O
cost	O
of	O
each	O
item	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
(	O
excluding	O
land	O
)	O
over	O
their	O
expected	O
useful	O
lives	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O
Field	O
equipment	O
10-20	O
years	O
Office	O
equipment	O
10	O
years	O
Motor	O
Vehicles	O
10	O
years	O
Software	O
10	O
years	O
The	O
residual	O
values	O
,	O
useful	O
lives	O
and	O
depreciation	O
methods	O
are	O
reviewed	O
,	O
and	O
adjusted	O
if	O
appropriate	O
,	O
at	O
each	O
reporting	O
date.	O

An	O
item	O
of	O
property	O
,	O
plant	O
and	O
equipment	O
is	O
de-recognised	O
upon	O
disposal	O
or	O
when	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
future	O
economic	O
benefit	O
to	O
the	O
Group.	O

Any	O
gains	O
and	O
losses	O
between	O
the	O
carrying	O
amount	O
and	O
the	O
disposal	O
proceeds	O
are	O
taken	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss.	O

Any	O
revaluation	O
surplus	O
reserve	O
relating	O
to	O
the	O
item	O
disposed	O
of	O
is	O
transferred	O
directly	O
to	O
retained	O
profits.	O

(	O
p	O
)	O
Leases	O
The	O
consolidated	O
entity	O
has	O
elected	O
not	O
to	O
recognise	O
a	O
right-of-use	O
asset	O
and	O

lease	O

for	O

of	O
12	O
months	O
or	O
less	O
and	O
leases	O
of	O

assets.	O

payments	O
on	O
these	O
assets	O
are	O
expensed	O
to	O
profit	O
or	O
loss	O
as	O
incurred.	O

(	O
q	O
)	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
assets	O
Exploration	O
and	O
evaluation	O
expenditure	O

of	O
interest	O
for	O

of	O
tenure	O
are	O
current	O
is	O
carried	O
forward	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
in	O
the	O
statement	O
of	O
financial	O
position	O
where	O
it	O

expected	O
that	O

a	O

a	O

in	O

the	O

When	O

The	O

farmee	O
